notes: On 11 December 2020, in Mocha Island, Biobio region, nearly 15 residents demonstrated against the arrival of tourists to the island. The group burned wood on the airstrip and demanded restricted access for non-residents, alluding to measures to prevent the spread of coronavirus in the area. Additionally, the group claimed the island lacks the infrastructure to receive tourists. [size=nearly 15]

On 11 December 2020, in Santiago, Metropolitana region, a little more than 100 citizens staged an anti-government demonstration. The group demanded the release of citizens arrested during the political unrest of October 2019. Police forces used tear gas and water cannons to disperse the group, while demonstrators threw rocks and other objects against officers, and built barricades across the streets. A bank and a local store were looted by a group of rioters. Police arrested 18 people. One demonstrator lost eyesight after a pellet impacted his head. [size=a little more than 100]

Around 11 December 2020, in Arica, Arica y Parinacota region, Afro-Chilean people protested over the designation of seats for this community to draft the new constitution. The group protested near the city hall to demand the assignation of seats for members of this community. [size=no report]

On 11 December 2020, in La Serena, Coquimbo region, hundreds of families protested over a housing crisis in the commune. The group marched through the city to demand their right to access decent housing and criticized excessive delays in the construction of new social housing projects. [size=hundreds of families]

source: El Sur; La Estrella Concepcion; El Mercurio (Chile)
notes: On 10 December 2020, in the rural area of Canete, Biobio region, suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire a hotel, a private house, one warehouse, and several vehicles near the Lanalhue Lake. Perpetrators threatened people that were in the area at the moment of the attack. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights. No injuries were reported

source: 24 Horas (Chile); La Estrella Del Loa; La Nacion (Chile)
notes: On 10 December 2020, in Estacion Central, Metropolitana region, citizens staged a demonstration and blocked the traffic in Alameda avenue. Police forces used tear gas and water cannons to disperse the group. A group of between 20 to 30 demonstrators set fire to four busses of public service. Demonstrators demanded the release of citizens arrested during the political unrest of October 2019. Police arrested 9 people, while a second source claimed in total 17 people were arrested. [size=between 20 to 30]

On 10 December 2020, in the rural area of Nueva Tolten, Araucania region, a group of suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to several pieces of machinery that belong to a logging company in the area San Jorge Los Boldos. Perpetrators raided the area and shot at workers and subsequently burned the machines. Pamphlets connecting the attack to Mapuche indigenous people were found in the area. One worker was reported injured.

On 10 December 2020, in Santiago, Metropolitana region, citizens staged a demonstration near the Ministry of Education. Police forces used tear gas and water cannons to disperse the group, while demonstrators used rocks and other objects against officers. A bus stop was set on fire by demonstrators. The group demanded the release of citizens arrested during the political unrest of October 2019. [size=no report]

On 10 December 2020, in Coquimbo, Coquimbo region, women and feminist organizations protested against gender-based violence. The group marched through the streets to demand justice for the victims in a femicide case. [size=no report]

source: La Estrella Concepcion; El Sur; El Mercurio (Chile)
notes: On 9 December 2020, in Antiquina, Biobio region, a group of 50 suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to a truck loaded with liquified gas. The armed men forced the driver out of the vehicle. Subsequently, they used the vehicle to block the road that connects Canete and Tirua. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights and the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. No injured were reported.

source: El Mercurio (Chile); El Sur; La Estrella Concepcion
notes: On 9 December 2020, in the rural area of Contulmo, Biobio region, a group of suspected indigenous militiamen stole a pick-up truck that belonged to an environmental NGO. The victims, workers of the mentioned organization, were forced off the vehicle by the armed men, who later set fire to the car near the route P60. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights. No injured were reported.

Around 9 December 2020 (from 4 - 9 December), In Tome, Biobio region, hospital workers protested over the dismissal of several of their colleagues. The group demanded work security and the renovation of the work contract for all the personal of the hospital. [size=no report]

On 9 December 2020, in Osorno, Los Lagos region, citizens protested over a housing crisis in the commune. The group demanded their right to access decent housing and criticized excessive delays in the construction of current projects. Protesters gathered during a visit of the minister for housing and urban development in the city. [size=no report]

source: El Austral Osorno; El Austral Valdivia
notes: On 8 December 2020, in the rural area of San Juan de La Costa, Los Lagos region, a group of four suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to four vehicles that belonged to a local logging company located on a plot of land in the Punotro Alto area. Perpetrators beat up a worker who was on the property and fired shots into the air several times to intimidate the operator. Pamphlets found in the area connected the attack to the CAM.

On 8 December 2020, in the rural area of Tirua, Biobio region, suspected indigenous militiamen opened fire against a police unit that was driving in the km 45 of route P72S. No officers were reported injured.

On 8 December 2020, on Route 68 near Curacavi, Metropolitana region, a group of citizens blocked the traffic on the highway for several hours to protest. The group was dispersed by police forces. The reason for the protest was not mentioned in the reports. [size=no report]

On 7 December 2020, in Hualqui, Biobio region, residents protested against delays in the police investigation for a case of disappearance. The victim disappeared while hiking on the banks near the Biobio river. Citizens organized a candle vigil to demand advances in the search operation. [size=no report]

On 5 December 2020, in Puente Alto, Metropolitana, a group of rioters attacked a man that allegedly robbed a woman. Perpetrators tightened and beat up the victim. The man died due to the severity of the injuries. [size=no report]

On 5 December 2020, in the rural area of Collipulli, Araucania region, Mapuche indigenous people demonstrated to demand the return of the so-called ancestral lands to the Mapuche community. The group blocked with barricades the access of workers at the crop fields located in the disputed areas. [size=no report]

On 4 December 2020, in Puerto Montt, Los Lagos region, workers of food delivery apps protested against the poor working conditions of the group. The group gathered to demand social security rights and more security to perform their work. The protest followed the death of one member of the group killed in a traffic accident. [size=no report]

On 4 December 2020, in Santiago, Metropolitana, demonstrators demanded the release of people arrested during the political unrest of 2019. Groups of citizens blocked the traffic with barricades, vandalized a bus of public service and threw stones against police officers. Police forces attempted to disperse the group with tear gas and water cannons. 21 people were arrested and ten police officers were reported injured. [size=no report]

On 3 December 2020, in Arica, Arica y Parinacota region, citizens protested against the eviction of a group of people from private property. Protesters demanded more housing as a condition to leave the area. [size=no report]

On 2 December 2020, in Puerto Montt, Los Lagos region, residents protested against delays in the police investigation for a case of disappearance. The victim never returned home after a work-day. Family and other citizens marched to demand justice. [size=no report]

On 2 December 2020, in Isla Maillen, Los Lagos region, residents protested against delays in the police investigation for a case of disappearance. The victim never returned home after a work-day. Citizens organized a candle vigil to demand justice. [size=no report]

On 2 December 2020, in the rural area of Ercilla, Araucania region, clashes between police forces and suspected indigenous militiamen were reported. The police unit answered a call for domestic violence when the group was ambushed. There have been several attacks in the Araucania region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights. No fatalities or injured were reported.

Around 2 December 2020, in the rural area of San Miguel de Azapa, Arica y Parinacota region, farmers and residents protested against the misappropriation of a plot of land. The group took the property and demanded to revoke the ownership to proceed with the construction of a park and a school in the area, as it was planned. [size=no report]

Around 2 December 2020 (as reported), in Taltal, Antofagasta, citizens protested over a case of medical malpractice in a case of a 7-year-old child. The group gathered near the tribunal to demand justice for the victim who died followed a missed diagnosis by local doctors. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: Labour Group (Chile); NO+AFP: No More AFP
notes: Around 1 December 2020, in San Antonio, Valparaiso, people and members of the No+AFP staged a protest. Protesters showed their support for the approval of a bill that would allow workers to receive again a percentage of their pension retirement fund to face the economic crisis amid the coronavirus pandemic.[size=no report]

On 1 December 2020, in Osorno, Los Lagos region, nearly 50 store and restaurant owners protested over shutdown regulations due to the coronavirus pandemic. The group claimed the temporary closure of restaurants and local stores affected their income. The group gathered to march towards the main square to demand the end of quarantine measures. Police stopped the protest and arrested 14 people. [size=nearly 50]

assoc_actor_1: Health Workers (Chile); FENATS: National Federation of Health Workers
notes: On 1 December 2020, in Concepcion, Biobio region, health workers and workers affiliated to FENATS protested against the dismissal of nearly 100 of their co-workers. The group gathered to demand the reintegration of the workers and improvements in their work contracts. [size=no report]

On 1 December 2020, in Santiago, Metropolitana, a group of street sellers and informal workers demonstrated against the lack of space assigned to sell their products. The group demanded a system to assign them spaces to work. Clashes between police forces and demonstrators were reported when the latter blocked a nearby avenue with barricades. Police forces used tear gas and water cannons. One person was injured. [size=no report]

On 1 December 2020, in Copiapo, Atacama region, citizens protested to demand the release of people arrested during the political unrest of 2019. Family and friends gathered near the tribunal to demand the release of the prisoners. [size=no report]

Around 1 December 2020, in Arica, Arica y Parinacota, a group of citizens protested over poor infrastructure in their neighborhood. Residents demanded improvements in the street pavement and sewage system. The group gathered with black flags and blocked the streets for several hours. [size=no report]

On 1 December 2020, in Curanilahue, Biobio region, store and restaurant owners protested over shutdown regulations due to the coronavirus pandemic. The group claimed the temporary closure of restaurants and local stores affected their income. The group organized a motorcade through the city to demand the end of quarantine measures. [size=no report]

Around 30 November 2020, in Puerto Montt, Los Lagos, a group of 40 store and restaurant owners protested over shutdown regulations due to the coronavirus pandemic. The group claimed the temporary closure of restaurants and local stores affected their income. The group gathered and traveled by bus to Santiago to deliver a letter demanding the end of quarantine measures in their communes. [size=40]

On 30 November 2020, in Las Condes, Metropolitana region, at least 12 people from Penalolen protested over a housing crisis in the commune. The group demanded their right to decent housing and called for the construction of more social housing projects. Protesters blocked a street for several hours.[size=at least 12]

On 30 November 2020, in Arica, Arica y Parinacota, citizens protested against delays in ongoing investigations of human rights abuses and police brutality incidents in the country. The group gathered near the tribunal to demand justice for the victims. [size=no report]

On 28 November 2020, in La Union, Los Rios region, nearly 60 store and restaurant owners protested over shutdown regulations due to the coronavirus pandemic. The group claimed the temporary closure of restaurants and local stores affected their income. The group protested during an inaugural ceremony carried out by local authorities and demanded the end of quarantine measures. [size=nearly 60]

On 27 November 2020, in Antofagasta, Antofagasta region, people protested to demand the release of people arrested during the political unrest of 2019. The group also demonstrated against the announcement of the government to prevent the approval of a bill that would allow workers to receive again a percentage of their pension retirement fund to face the economic crisis amid the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]

On 27 November 2020, in Santiago, Metropolitana, people staged an anti-government demonstration. Groups of demonstrators blocked the traffic and threw stones at police officers. Police forces attempted to disperse the group with tear gas and water cannons and arrested 25 people. Groups haves been demonstrating during the week against the government announcement to prevent the approval of a bill that would allow workers to receive again a percentage of their pension retirement fund to face the economic crisis amid the coronavirus pandemic. Additionally, the group demanded the release of the demonstrators arrested during the political unrest of 2019. A journalist that was covering the demonstrations reported severe burned injuries caused by the liquid of the water cannons used by police forces to disperse demonstrators. The victim required medical treatment for his injuries. [size=no report]

On 27 November 2020, in Labranza, Araucania region, a group of at least 6 suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to the model homes and sales offices of a housing project. Perpetrators raided the area, attacked the guards, and subsequently burned the building. Pamphlets connecting the attack to Mapuche indigenous people were found in the area. No injuries were reported.

On 27 November 2020, in Puente Alto, Metropolitana, people staged an anti-government demonstration. This week groups demonstrated against the government announcement to prevent the approval of a bill that would allow workers to receive again a percentage of their pension retirement fund to face the economic crisis amid the coronavirus pandemic. Additionally, the group demanded the release of the demonstrators arrested during the political unrest of 2019. There were reports of violence but no specific episode was mentioned. [size=no report]

On 27 November 2020, in La Serena, Coquimbo region, for the third consecutive day, a group of street sellers and informal workers demonstrated against the lack of space assigned to sell their products. The group demanded a formal system to assign them spaces to work. [size=no report]

source: La Estrella Concepcion; Biobio Chile; El Sur

A member of the political party DC participated in the event. [size=no report]

Protesters also rejected the excessive workload amid the coronavirus pandemic and demanded the hiring of more health workers in public hospitals. Protesters joined a national strike. On 26 November 2020, on Route P-72S, on a route that connects Canete and Tirua, Biobio region, a group of suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to a tanker truck. Perpetrators threatened the drivers before burning down the vehicle. No injuries were reported. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights.

On 26 November 2020, in Huentelolen, Biobio region, clashes between police forces and suspected indigenous militiamen were reported. The police unit answered a call for an arson attack when the group was ambushed. No injuries were reported.

On 26 November 2020, in La Serena, Coquimbo region, for the second consecutive day, a group of street sellers and informal workers demonstrated over the lack of space assigned to sell their products. The group demanded a formal system to assign them spaces to work. [size=no report]

On 26 November 2020, in Santiago, Metropolitana region, between 10 to 13 students and other citizens protested to demand the release of people arrested during the political unrest of 2019. The group chained themselves to the entrance of the congress building. A source reported that police arrested 13 people. [size=between 10 to 13]

On 26 November 2020, in Talca, Maule region, an explosive device exploded in a police station. The device was delivered by an unidentified man and contained the inscription: ''For your hard service''. Two officers were daze by the sound of the blast when the package was opened, but no one was injured. No group has been connected to the event.

On 25 November 2020, in Concepcion, Biobio region, store and restaurant owners from the city and other communes such as Lota and Coronel, protested over shutdown regulations due to the coronavirus pandemic. On 25 November 2020, in Iquique, Tarapaca region, owners of bars and local clubs protested over shutdowns measures due to coronavirus pandemic. The group demanded government support or the reopening of their businesses. [size=no report]

On 24 November 2020, in Tongoy, Coquimbo region, a group of nearly 20 citizens demonstrated against the arrest of a resident. The group attacked the police station to demand the release of the suspect who was accused of carrying a gun without a permit. [size=nearly 20]

On 24 November 2020, In Huechuraba, Metropolitana region, rioters set barricades to demonstrate against the Chilean government. One demonstrator was killed and another one injured after a car ran over them. In retaliation, demonstrators set fire to the vehicle. [size=no report]

Around 24 November 2020, in Puerto Montt, Los Lagos region, a group of nearly 50 people protested against an increase in crime in their neighborhood. There have been several attacks in the Araucania region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights.

Around 4 November 2020, in Valdivia, Los Rios region, citizens staged a protest over the killing of a transgender person. The group turned on candles and demanded justice for the victim and more protection for members of the LGBT community. [size=no report]

Around 4 November 2020, in the Metropolitan region [coded to Santiago], the resignation of the Minister of Interior was reported. The public officer decided to retire following a session of the house of Representatives in which it was approved to open an official investigation and temporally suspension of his duties due to excessive use of force by state forces during the political unrest of October 2019.

On 4 November 2020, in Arica, Arica y Parinacota region, nearly 100 store owners and businessmen protested over shutdown regulations due to the coronavirus pandemic. The group claimed the temporary closure of restaurants and local stores affected their income. The group marched on the streets to demand the end of the quarantine measure. [size=nearly 100]

On 4 November 2020, in Ercilla, Araucania region, suspected indigenous militiamen and police forces clashed. Militiamen set a vehicle on fire to block the road and subsequently opened fire against officers that arrived at the area. A military unit supported the police. Later the same day, suspected indigenous militiamen activated an improvised explosive device. Reports claimed the perpetrator used gas cylinders and other flammable elements to explode two pick-up trucks that had been reported stolen. No injuries were reported.
On 4 November 2020, in Estacion Central, Metropolitana, a group of 10 demonstrators set fire to a bus of public service. The reasons for the demonstration are not mentioned by the source. [size=10]

On 4 November 2020, in La Florida, Metropolitana, a group of citizens protested over the right to adequate housing. The group reported a lack of government will to provide social housing and demanded a project to improve their living conditions. [size=no report]

On 3 November 2020, in the rural area of Contulmo, Biobio region, a group of between 10 to 15 suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to seven vehicles that belonged to a local logging company Buchoco located in a plot of land near the route P-700. Workers claimed perpetrators used military gear and fired shots into the air several times to intimidate the operators. Workers were tight-up and beat up by perpetrators. One person was reported injured. Pamphlets were found in the area connected the attack to the Mapuche indigenous groups.

On 3 November 2020, in Concepcion, Biobio region, health workers and mayors of nearby communes protested over the lack of security equipment to treat patients with coronavirus. The group also rejected the excessive workload of health workers and demanded increases in the budget for local hospitals. [size=no report]

On 2 November 2020, in Osorno, Los Lagos region, store owners and businessmen protested over shutdown regulations due to the coronavirus pandemic. The group claimed the temporary closure of restaurants and local stores affected their income. The group marched through the streets to demand the end of the quarantine measure. [size=no report]

On 31 October 2020, in the route P-72s, that connects Canete and Tirua, Biobio region, demonstrators built barricades and set a pick-up truck on fire. The car belonged to a company. Police forces arrived in the area and removed the blockage, but no interaction with demonstrators were reported. The reason for the demonstration was not mentioned, but indigenous groups often demonstrated in the Biobio region to demand land rights. [size=no report]

Around 31 October 2020 (weekend of), a transgender man was killed and his body was found in the rural area of Valdivia, Los Rios region. The family of the victim expressed concerns about a homophobic attack. 1 fatality.

On 30 October 2020, in Metrenco, Araucania region, a group of 10 suspected indigenous militiamen opened fire against a police unit that was returning from an eviction process. One officer was killed. There have been several attacks in the Araucania region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights. 1 fatality.

source: 24 Horas (Chile); La Nacion (Chile); Biobio Chile; AFP
notes: On 30 October 2020, in Providencia, Metropolitana, a small group of demonstrators demanded the release of people arrested during the political unrest of 2019. Police dispersed the group when barricades were built. 20 people were arrested. [size=a small group]

On 30 October 2020, in Temuco, Araucania region, a group of people gathered near the police station to protest over a police officer killed during an ambush carried by suspected indigenous militias in the rural area of the region. On 30 October 2020, in the rural area of Padre Las Casas, Araucania region, police forces of Chile evicted a group of members of the Mapuche community from a property in the area. The event preceded an armed clashed between suspected indigenous militias and police forces. [size=no report]

On 25 October 2020, Chile held a referendum to decide whether the country's constitution, written over the military dictatorship times, should be changed. Nearly 78% of the electorate voted in favor of a new charter, and 79% of voters supported the election of a body of citizens to draft the new document. From Santiago, Metropolitan region, the President Sebastian Pinera (no party) made a public speech to accept the outcome.

On 8 October 2020, in Huentelolen, Biobio region, a group of citizens blocked the road to demand improvements in the town's health center. [size=no report]

source: La Estrella Concepcion; El Austral Temuco
notes: On 7 October 2020, in San Ernesto, Biobio region, a group of eight suspected indigenous militiamen set six vehicles and pieces of equipment that belonged to a logging company on fire. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights.

On 7 October 2020, in Iquique, Tarapaca region, a group of citizens protested over the implementation of a new constitution in the country. With the constitutional plebiscite expected to be held on 25 October 2020, a group of citizens gathered organized a motorcade across the city to show their disapproval to change the constitution. [size=no report]

On 7 October 2020, in Valdivia, Los Rios region, a group of health workers of a hospital protested to demand improvements in their work contracts and an increase in their wages. The group marched near the hospital facilities. [size=no report]

On 7 October 2020, in Providencia, Metropolitana, nearly 50 people demonstrated in the Baquedano square. Demonstrators clashed against police officers when the first blocked a nearby street. The reasons behind the demonstration were not mentioned but over the past days, citizens had gathered to demand justice in the case of a 16 year-old-injured by police forces. [size=nearly 50]

assoc_actor_1: Health Workers (Chile); FENATS: National Federation of Health Workers
notes: On 7 October 2020, in Calbuco, Los Lagos region, health workers affiliated to FENATS protested against the dismissal of several workers from a local hospital. The group claimed that the reduction of hospital personal amid the coronavirus pandemic would harm the attention of patients. The group gathered in front of the hospital to demand the reintegration of their colleagues. [size=no report]

On 6 October 2020, in Puente Alto, Metropolitana, nearly 150 people demonstrated against police brutality. People gathered to demand justice in the case of a 16 year-old-injured during a demonstration registered the week before. Demonstrators clashed against police forces and threw rocks and Molotov bombs at a police station. Barricades were built across the streets. [size=nearly 150]

assoc_actor_1: Students (Chile); ACES: Coordinating Assembly of High-school Students of Chile
notes: On 6 October 2020, in Nunoa, Metropolitana, a dozen of students members of ACES protested on the date that marked the anniversary of the political unrest of October 2019. The students displayed banners inside the metro station calling for government reforms. [size=a dozen]

Around 6 October 2020, in Castro, Los Lagos region, a group of nearly 25 people demonstrated to demand the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. Police arrested three people. There were reports of violence but not specific episode was mentioned. [size=nearly 25]

On 6 October 2020, in Valdivia, Los Rios region, a group of health workers of a hospital protested to demand improvements in their work contracts and an increase in their wages. The group staged a pot-banging protest in front of the hospital facilities. [size=no report]

On 6 October 2020, in Providencia, Metropolitana, nearly 60 people demonstrated in the Baquedano square. Demonstrators blocked the streets and threw objects at police officers in the area. The reasons behind the demonstration were not mentioned but over the past days, citizens had gathered to demand justice in the case of a 16 year-old-injured by police forces. [size=nearly 60]

Around 6 October 2020 (as reported), in Valdivia, Los Rios region, workers of a local company protested against the shut down of the company. Workers gathered near the main square and urged the government to support local companies. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: Health Workers (Chile); FENATS: National Federation of Health Workers
notes: On 6 October 2020, in Concepcion, Biobio region, health workers affiliated to FENATS protested over the lack of security equipment to treat patients with coronavirus. The group demanded improvements in their working conditions and additional payments for excessive workload during the pandemic. Police intervened and arrested seven protesters. [size=no report]

On 6 October 2020, in Antofagasta, Antofagasta region, a group of citizens protested over the implementation of a new constitution in the country. With the constitutional plebiscite expected to be held on 25 October 2020, a group of citizens gathered to drive in a motorcade chanting slogans against the approval. [size=no report]

On 5 October 2020, in Nunoa, Metropolitana, citizens demonstrated against the government and police brutality. People gathered to demand justice in the case of a 16 year-old-injured during a demonstration registered the week before. Police used water cannons to disperse the group. Demonstrators set a bus of public service on fire. No injured reported. [size=no report]

On 5 October 2020, in Providencia, Metropolitana, nearly 300 people demonstrated against the government and police brutality. People gathered to demand justice in the case of a 16 year-old-injured during a demonstration registered the week before. Demonstrators built and set barricades on fire across the streets, while a second group banged pots in a pot-banging demonstration. Police dispersed the group. [size=nearly 300]

On 5 October 2020, in San Ramon, Metropolitana, a group of nearly 100 citizens demonstrated against delays in the construction of social housing projects for the residents of the commune. The group claimed that the plot assigned for the construction is occupied by a car-selling company. Protesters blocked the traffic in the freeway for several minutes. [size=nearly 100]

On 5 October 2020, in Valdivia, Los Rios region, a group of nearly 60 health workers of a hospital protested to demand improvements in their work contracts and an increase in their wages. The group staged a pot-banging protest in front of the hospital facilities. [size=nearly 60]

On 5 October 2020, in Maipu, Metropolitana, citizens demonstrated on the date that marked the anniversary of the referendum that overthrown the military dictatorship in the country. The group demanded the resignation of the commander of police forces following reports of police brutality against a 16-year-old. There were reports of violence but not particular episode was mentioned. [size=no report]

On 5 October 2020, in Santiago, Metropolitana, nearly 100 citizens demonstrated on the date that marked the anniversary of the referendum that overthrown the military dictatorship in the country. The group demanded the resignation of the commander of police forces following reports of police brutality against a 16-year-old. Police used water cannons when demonstrators blocked the streets, to which the latter responded by throwing stones and other objects against the officers. 18 people were arrested. [size=nearly 100]

On 5 October 2020, in Valdivia, Los Rios region, a group of nearly 30 women protested against gender-based violence. Protesters gathered near the tribunal building to demand justice in a case of femicide reported in the city. [size=nearly 30]

On 5 October 2020, in Quilpue, Valparaiso region, hundreds of citizens demonstrated on the date that marked the anniversary of the referendum that overthrown the military dictatorship in the country. The group demanded the resignation of the commander of police forces following reports of police brutality against a 16-year-old. Police used tear gas while demonstrators responded by throwing stones and other objects against the officers. Two people were arrested. [size=hundreds]

On 5 October 2020, in Valdivia, Los Rios region, nearly 50 citizens, mostly high school students, protested on the date that marked the anniversary of the referendum that overthrown the military dictatorship in the country. The group demanded the resignation of the commander of police forces following reports of police brutality against a 16-year-old. A protester was severely injured when a private car ran against the group. It was unclear if the driver intentionally ran over the demonstrators, but the driver fled after the accident. [size=no report]

On 5 October 2020, in Copiapo, Atacama region, citizens demonstrated on the date that marked the anniversary of the referendum that overthrown the military dictatorship in the country. There were reports of clashes between demonstrators and police forces. Officers used tear gas and water cannons to disperse the group when barricades were built across the streets. [size=no report]

On 5 October 2020, in Monte Patria, Coquimbo region, residents protested against the illegal extraction of water in the region. The group blocked a group of machines that were dragging in a local river. [size=no report]

On 5 October 2020, in Arica, Arica y Parinacota region, citizens affiliated to feminist organizations, students' groups, and native indigenous people groups protested on the date that marked the anniversary of the referendum that overthrown the military dictatorship in the country. The group gathered near the tribunal and demanded the release of people arrested during the political unrest of October 2019. [size=no report]

On 5 October 2020, in Curanilahue, Biobio region, workers of a local company protested against delays in payment of their wages. Workers urged the company to pay the debts and blocked the main entrance to the offices for several hours. [size=no report]

On 5 October 2020, in Antofagasta, Antofagasta region, hundreds of citizens demonstrated on the date that marked the anniversary of the referendum that overthrown the military dictatorship in the country. Demonstrators built and set barricades on fire, while official sources reported damages in several street lights across the city. The group demanded the resignation of the commander of police forces following reports of police brutality against a 16-year-old. [size=hundreds]

On 5 October 2020, in La Serena, Coquimbo, citizens demonstrated on the date that marked the anniversary of the referendum that overthrown the military dictatorship in the country. The group demanded the resignation of the commander of police forces and the release of people arrested during the political unrest of October 2019. The event followed reports of police brutality against a 16-year-old. There were reports of violence and barricades. [size=a dozen]

On 5 October 2020, in Coquimbo, Coquimbo, nearly 100 citizens demonstrated on the date that marked the anniversary of the referendum that overthrown the military dictatorship in the country. The group demanded the resignation of the commander of police forces and the release of political prisoners, following reports of police brutality against a 16-year-old. There were reports of violence and barricades. [size=nearly 100]

On 5 October 2020, in San Antonio, Valparaiso region, citizens demonstrated on the date that marked the anniversary of the referendum that overthrown the military dictatorship in the country. The group demanded the resignation of the commander of police forces following reports of police brutality against a 16-year-old, and the release of people arrested during the political unrest of October 2019. Demonstrators vandalized the local stadium and built barricades across the streets. [size=no report]

Around 4 October 2020, near Los Angeles, Biobio region, colleagues and family of a worker killed during an attack carried out by suspected indigenous militiamen protested to demand justice for the victim. The group organized a motorcade in the Route 5 and demanded more security for workers of logging companies in the region. [size=no report]

On 4 October 2020, in Santiago, Metropolitana, a large group of citizens demonstrated over the implementation of a new constitution in the country. With the constitutional referendum expected to be held on 25 October 2020, a group of citizens gathered with bicycles and rode from Santiago to Providencia while chanting slogans pro-approval. There were reports of violence when the group reached the Providencia area but no particular episode was mentioned. [size=a large group]

On 4 October 2020, in Puente Alto, Metropolitana, nearly 400 people demonstrated against police brutality. People gathered to demand justice in the case of a 16 year-old-injured during a demonstration registered the day before. Demonstrators set a bus of public service on fire and threw rocks and Molotov bombs at a police station. Police arrested 5 people. No injured reported. [size=nearly 400]

On 3 October 2020, in Providencia, Metropolitana, more than 1,000 people gathered in protest at Italia Square to decry the act of violence perpetrated by a police officer during a demonstration on 2 October 2020, over the Chilean national plebiscite. The event took place after the latter was arrested for having pushed a teenager from the Pio Nono bridge after he attempted to arrest him. [size=more than 1,000]

Around 3 October 2020 (as reported), in Colliguay, Valparaiso region, citizens protested against a mining project in the area. The group expressed their concerns regarding the negative impacts on the environment and eco-systems of the town. [size=no report]

On 3 October 2020, in Providencia, Metropolitana, a group of demonstrators clashed against police forces during a demonstration against police brutality. Citizens gathered to demand justice in the case of a 16 year-old-injured by police forces. A group vandalized public monuments and built barricades across the streets. 20 were arrested and 12 police officers were reported injured. [size=no report]

On 3 October 2020, in the rural area of Collipulli, Araucania region, suspected indigenous militiamen carried out an attack at the Agua Buena agricultural plot, where they killed a worker whilst he was driving a truck carrying more people. The latter were imposed to get off the vehicle, which was set on fire thereafter. Pamphlets demanding the release of arrested Mapuche individuals were found in the area.

source: 24 Horas (Chile); La Tercera (Chile); AFP; Biobio Chile; La Nacion (Chile); Chanarcillo; La Cuarta (Chile)
notes: On 2 October 2020, in Santiago (Metropolitana), an estimate of 200 people took to the streets of the city, in the surrounding area of the Baquedano square, in a demonstration against the national Government and in favor of the Chilean national plebiscite to draft a new constitution. A group of rioters clashed with police in the aftermath of the event, leading the latter to employ water tanks and tear gas to disperse the demonstration. A teenager was deliberately pushed from a bridge by an officer after the latter started chasing a group of demonstrators. The condition of the victim was stable. 16 demonstrators were arrested, together with the suspected officer who tossed the victim. [size=an estimate of 200]

On 2 October 2020, in San Pedro de Atacama (Antofagasta), dozens of business owners and workers from the tourist sector staged a protest at the main square against strict regulation due to the coronavirus pandemic. Protesters urged authorities to soften the latter and allow the re-opening of touristic areas given the severe economic impact the crisis is causing in the region. [size=dozens]

Around 1 October 2020 (as reported), in La Union (Los Rios), residents from the Aldea Campesina neighbourhood gathered in protest against the unsanitary conditions in the community due to the lack of a sewage system. Protesters urged authorities to address the situation. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: Mapuche Indigenous Group (Chile); Government of Chile (2018-)
notes: Around 1 October 2020, in Valdivia, Los Rios region, nearly 100 Mapuche indigenous people and other citizens protest against the construction of a dam in the San Pedro River. Protesters claimed the project would cause environmental damages. Local government authorities also participated in the protest. [size=nearly 100]

On 1 October 2020, near Curanipe municipality (Maule), suspected indigenous militiamen shot at a worker from a forestry company near the Matanzas agricultural plot. Investigations were ongoing, and neither injuries nor fatalities were reported.

On 30 September 2020, in Iquique, Tarapaca region, hundreds of business owners protested over strict regulation due to the coronavirus pandemic. The group claimed that the shut downs have affected their income and demanded the re-opening of stores and services considered as non-basic. Protester marched to the municipality. [size=hundreds]

Around 30 September 2020 (weekend of), in Las Condes, Metropolitana, citizens protested against the construction of a social housing project in the neighborhood. The group claimed that the commune needs more green areas instead of housing. [size=no report]

On 30 September 2020, in Santiago, Metropolitana, a group of citizens protested over delays in the construction of a social housing project that would benefit families from the Penanolen commune. The group gathered near the Ministry to demand the prioritization of decent housing. [size=no report]

Around 30 September 2020, in Santiago, Metropolitana, citizens affiliated to the No+TAG movements protested against the lack of facilities to pay traffic fines. The group claimed that the collection companies are ignoring the benefits allowed by law to pay the tickets. [size=no report]

On 30 September 2020, in Santiago, Metropolitana, thousands of citizens protested against the increasing number of cyclists involved in accidents with motor vehicles. The group biked around the city to demand better routes for people that favor biking in the city. [size=thousands]

On 29 September 2020, in the Araucania region, artists' unions protested over the lack of financial support during the coronavirus pandemic. The group organized activities in several towns to demand government measures to mitigate the economic crisis that affect their economic activity and raise awareness of their current working conditions. [size=no report]

On 29 September 2020, in Valparaiso, Valparaiso region, artists' unions protested over the lack of financial support during the coronavirus pandemic. The group organized activities to demand government measures to mitigate the economic crisis that affect their economic activity and raise awareness of their current working conditions. [size=no report]

On 29 September 2020, in Coquimbo, Coquimbo region, artists' unions protested over the lack of financial support during the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]

On 29 September 2020, in Antofagasta, Antofagasta region, artists' unions protested over the lack of financial support during the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]

On 29 September 2020, in Chillan, Maule region, artists' unions protested over the lack of financial support during the coronavirus pandemic. The group organized activities to demand government measures to mitigate the economic crisis that affect their economic activity and raise awareness of their current working conditions. [size=no report]

On 29 September 2020, in Santiago, Metropolitana, artists' unions protested over the lack of financial support during the coronavirus pandemic. The group marched towards the city center to demand government measures to mitigate the economic crisis that affect their economic activity. [size=no report]

On 29 September 2020, in Concepcion (Biobio), workers from the entertainment sector installed a number of empty cases at the campus of Concepcion University as a way of protest over strict regulation due to the coronavirus pandemic. Protesters aimed at shedding light on their struggle over the last months. [size=no report]

source: Biobio Chile; La Estrella Concepcion; La Nacion (Chile)
notes: On 29 September 2020, in Calebu, Araucania region, a group of nearly 40 rioters from a Mapuche indigenous community attacked a group of police officers that were patrolling the area. According to the reports, residents complained about the presence of police forces in the area before attacking the group with sticks, rocks, and other objects. A second source reported that some of the rioters were armed. Three officers were reported injured and at least two police vehicles were burned down. [size=nearly 40]

Around 28 September 2020 (as reported), in La Union, Los Lagos region, citizens protested against the lack of an operative sewer system. Protesters claimed their houses get often floated with wastewater. According to the report, the group protests every afternoon since several weeks. [size=no report]

On 28 September 2020, in Pucon, Araucania region, workers of a construction site protested against payment delays in their salaries. The group gathered to protest near the area and urged their employer to pay the debts. [size=no report]

On 28 September 2020, in Valdivia, Los Rios region, teachers protested against the reopening of schools amid the coronavirus pandemic. The group demanded improvement of the protection and sanitation protocols before returning to the classrooms. [size=no report]

On 28 September 2020, in the rural area of San Jose de la Mariquina, Los Rios region, suspected indigenous militiamen set an excavator on fire. There have been several attacks in the Los Rios region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights. Pamphlets demanding the release of arrested Mapuche individuals were found in the area.

On 28 September 2020, in Canete, Biobio region, nearly 300 citizens protested over the murder of a man killed by suspected indigenous militiamen, on 8 September 2020. Protesters marched to demand justice for the victims and to speed up the police investigation to find the perpetrators. [size=nearly 300]

source: El Austral Temuco; El Mercurio (Chile); Biobio Chile
notes: On 28 September 2020, in the rural area of Padre Las Casas, Araucania region, suspected indigenous militiamen set machinery from a industrial farming company on fire. Nearly 12 men broke into the area and threatened the workers. Pamphlets connecting the attack to the CAM were found in the area.

source: El Austral Temuco; Biobio Chile; El Mercurio (Chile)
notes: On 28 September 2020, on Route 5, near Pidima (Araucania), suspected indigenous militiamen set a truck on fire. The group forced the driver to stop by opening fire against the driver and then proceeded to burn down the vehicle. No injured were reported.

On 28 September 2020, in Iquique, Tarapaca region, business owners protested over strict regulation due to the coronavirus pandemic. The group claimed that the shut downs have affected their income and demanded the re-opening of stores and services considered as non-basic. Protester marched to the municipality to deliver a letter with their demands. [size=no report]

On 26 September 2020, in Coquimbo, Coquimbo, riots broke out during a funeral as police forces attempted to enforce the no large-gathering law created over the coronavirus pandemic. Police intervened when neighbors reported some fireworks. Police arrested 7 people. [size=at least 7]

On 26 September 2020, in Osorno, Los Lagos region, a group of citizens protested over the implementation of a new constitution in the country. With the constitutional referendum expected to be held on 25 October 2020, a group of citizens gathered with bicycles and chanted slogans pro-approval. A second group organized a motorcade across the city to show their disapproval to change the constitution. [size=no report]

Around 26 September 2020, in Pucon, Araucania region, citizens protested over the death of a child in an accident near the bus terminal. The victim died after a wall installed by the building administration fell over him. Protesters demand reparation for the victim's family. [size=no report]

Around 26 September 2020, in La Union, Los Rios region, citizens protested to demand improvements in the sewage system of their neighborhood. The group demanded the intervention of the municipal government. [size=no report]

On 26 September 2020, in Canete, Biobio region, a large group of citizens protested over the murder of a man killed by suspected indigenous militiamen, on 8 September 2020. Protesters demanded justice for the victims and to speed up the police investigation to find the perpetrators. The group staged a gathering near the place where the attack took place. [size=a large group]

Around 25 September 2020 (as reported), in Osorno, Los Lagos region, a group of nearly 50 citizens, mostly women, protested to demand justice in a case of sexual harassment. The group gathered in the main square and demanded justice after the trial against the presume attackers was delayed due to the coronavirus pandemic. [size=nearly 50]

On 25 September 2020, in Pudahuel, Metropolitana, a group of citizens protested against the increasing number of cyclists involved in accidents with motor vehicles. The group demanded better routes for people that favor biking in the city. [size=no report]

On 25 September 2020, in Providencia, Metropolitana, a group of at least 100 nurses and health technicians demonstrated to demand formal recognition of their degrees in the National Health Code. The group claimed this change would improve their work conditions. Police forces used water cannons to disperse demonstrators when a group blocked the traffic. Some stores of the area reported damages. Police arrested 16 people. [size=at least 100]

On 25 September 2020, in Iquique, Tarapaca region, business owners staged a pot-banging protest against coronavirus restrictions. The group claimed that the measures affected their stores and demanded to re-open other economic sectors. [size=no report]

On 24 September 2020, in Temuco, Araucania region, kindergarten teachers protested against the opening of daycare institutions in the region. The group claimed that improvements of the protocol to prevent the spread of coronavirus among children have to be made before opening the schools. [size=no report]

On 24 September 2020, in Corral, Los Rios region, citizens protested over delays on the investigation of a boat accident that killed more than 6 fishermen. Protesters claimed that the authorities have not provided any answer to the victims' families and demand measures to avoid repeating similar accidents in the future. [size=no report]

On 24 September 2020, in route P72, between Canete and Tirua, Biobio region, a group of suspected indigenous militiamen threatened a bus driver and subsequently set on fire a bus of public service. No injuries were reported. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights.

On 24 September 2020, in Santo Domingo, Valparaiso region, residents protested against the mobility restrictions imposed due to the coronavirus outbreak. The group claimed that the regulation affects their everyday lives, including work. Protesters demand more flexible regulations for residents. [size=no report]

On 24 September 2020, in the rural area of Lumaco, Araucania region, suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire two trucks that worked for a logging company. There have been several attacks in the Araucania region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights. Perpetrators used the vehicles to block the road before burning them down. Pamphlets connecting the attack to the CAM were found in the area.

On 24 September 2020, in Providencia, Metropolitana, a group of citizens members of a local art collective staged a protest to raise awareness of racism against Mapuche communities in the country. The group screened large imagines over one of the walls in the square. According to the members of the collective, police used a reflector to censor the image. [size=no report]

On 24 September 2020, near Canete, Biobio region, suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire a truck that belonged to a logging company. The attack occurred in the km 33 of route P70 in an area known as El Pino. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights.

On 23 September 2020, in San Antonio, Valparaiso region, police forces beat up a leader of the port workers' union. Police claimed that the event was related to a robbery in a local restaurant. This version was debunked by the dinner's owner. The victim was hospitalized due to the severity of the injuries.

On 23 September 2020, in Pudahuel, Metropolitana, a group of nearly 40 people demonstrated against the construction of an apartment building. The group claimed the neighborhood is lacking green areas and parks. Demonstrators set objects of fire and sprayed graffito in the walls. The group attacked a group of police officer that arrived to the area to control the demonstration. [size=nearly 40]

On 23 September 2020, in Santiago , Metropolitana, workers of the Metro system protested over staff cutbacks in the company. The group protested during the speech of the president and demanded job security. [size=no report]

On 22 September 2020, in Curico, Maule region, a group of citizens protested to demand justice in a case of sexual and gender-based violence. The group demanded justice for the victim. [size=no report]

On 22 September 2020, in the rural area of Nueva Imperial, Araucania region, suspected indigenous militiamen opened fire against a firefighter company. There have been several attacks in the Araucania region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights. No injuries were reported.

Around 22 September 2020, in La Florida, Metropolitana, a group of citizens protested to demand justice in a case of a person killed by a stray bullet during a shoot-out between gangs, registered over the past days. The group demanded advances in the police investigation and more security for residents. [size=no report]

On 22 September 2020, in the rural area of Los Angeles, Biobio region, nearly 50 citizens protested against the construction of a wind farm. The group gathered together in Route Q180 and expressed their concerns that the project would affect the quality of life of locals. [size=nearly 50]

Around 22 September 2020, in Los Angeles, Biobio region, a group of citizens protested over the lack of government support and food assistance to families affected by the economic crisis caused by the coronavirus pandemic. The group demanded the distribution of food supplies for residents of Villa los Profesores. [size=no report]

On 20 September 2020, in the rural area of Quidico, Biobio region, suspected indigenous militiamen opened fire against a police unit patrolling the area near the km 45. Two officers were reported injured. There have been several attacks in the Araucania region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights and the release of arrested Mapuche individuals.

On 18 September 2020, in Ercilla, Araucania region, suspected indigenous militiamen opened fired against the private houses of a recognized industrial farmer. The victim claimed this is the second attack in less than 10 days and demanded police protection. No injuries were reported. Pamphlets connecting the attack to Mapuche militia groups were found in the area.

On 18 September 2020, in Cartagena, Valparaiso region, a group of nearly 10 rioters attacked an ambulance and a military truck with rocks and other objects. The health workers were attending an emergency call when the group, started the attack. The military car was attending the call of the workers attacked. No injuries were reported. [size=nearly 10]

Around 17 September 2020 (as reported), in La Cisterna, Metropolitana, two LGBT activists were killed and their bodies were found in a house burned down Further police investigation proved that the victims had injuries not related to the fire. LGBT organizations claimed the victims were killed due to their activist work.

On 17 September 2020, near Ercilla, Araucania region, a group of demonstrators used a car as a barricade across the Route 5. The group burned down the vehicle, interrupting the traffic for several hours. Near the area, a banner demanding the release of arrested Mapuche individuals was found. A second source reported armed confrontations, but this version has yet to be confirmed. [size=no report]

On 17 September 2020, in Puente Alto, Metropolitana, a group of nearly 50 rioters attacked a group of civilians that were allegedly robbing a woman. The victims had to be interned in the hospital due to their injuries. [size=nearly 50]

Around 17 September 2020, in Arica, Arica y Parinacota region, residents of the Agtima neighborhood protested over an increase of insecurity in the area. The protested followed a robbery that resulted in one person killed. The group demanded more police presence. [size=no report]

On 17 September 2020, in Santo Domingo, Valparaiso region, residents protested against the mobility restrictions imposed due to the coronavirus outbreak. The group claimed that the regulation affected their everyday lives, including work. Protesters demand more flexible regulations for residents. [size=no report]

On 16 September 2020, in Lo Espejo, Metropolitana, a group of nearly 30 people gathered in the wake of a funeral. Riots broke out as police forces attempted to enforce the no large-gathering law created over the coronavirus pandemic. Police used water cannons to disperse the group. 5 people were arrested. [size=nearly 30]

On 16 September 2020, in Temuco, Araucania region, nearly 200 Mapuche indigenous people demonstrated against police brutality and excessive use of force against members of the community. The group clashed against police forces when state forces attempted to disperse the group. 21 people were arrested and 5 police officers were reported injured. [size=nearly 200]

On 16 September 2020, in route 150 near Penco, Biobio region, a group of demonstrators set on fire a barricade across the road. A bus driver was reported injured when another car ran over him while attempting to remove the blockage. The motive for the demonstration was not mentioned by the source. [size=no report]

On 15 September 2020, in Santiago, Metropolitana, members of the LGBT community protested against the lack of enactment of laws to improve inclusion and promotion of rights for member of LGBT groups. The group demanded the dismissal of the Minister of Equality, claiming a lack of action to perform her tasks. [size=no report]

source: El Sur; La Estrella Concepcion; Biobio Chile
notes: On 15 September 2020, near Tirua, Biobio region, suspected indigenous militiamen attacked a group of workers of a local logging company. The armed men opened fire against the group when these were arriving at their workplace on buses in Route P-95. Subsequently, perpetrators set a vehicle on fire before running away. Two workers were reported injured.

Around 15 September 2020 (month of), in Osorno, Los Lagos region, citizens protested over delays in the construction of a social housing project. Protesters claimed that there is a lack of information in the advances of the designs. [size=no report]

On 14 September 2020, in Santiago, Metropolitana, a group of women protested against the increasing violence in the south of the country. The group gathered to deliver a letter to show their support to the victims of arson attacks and raise awareness about the conflict in the southern regions of the country. [size=no report]

On 14 September 2020, in the rural area of Collipulli, Araucania region, members of the Mapuche community occupied a plot of land, claiming it belonged to the indigenous community. The building was burned down by unidentified perpetrators the day before the occupation. Police arrived and evicted the group. [size=no report]

On 14 September 2020, in Canete, Biobio region, a group of nearly 500 citizens protested to demand justice in a case of a person killed by suspected indigenous militiamen. The group marched through the streets demanding advances in the police investigation. [size=nearly 500]

On 14 September 2020, in Ercilla, Araucania region, Araucania region, suspected indigenous militiamen attacked a group of police officers near the police station. The group opened fire and subsequently ran away in a pick-up truck. Two police officers were reported injured by pieces of glass.

On 14 September 2020, near Valdivia, Los Rios region, a group of demonstrators clashed against police forces. The group built barricades to block the route T-340 in Pellines. The motive for the demonstration was no reported by the source. [size=no report]

On 14 September 2020, in La Reina, Metropolitana, a group of residents protested against the selling of a public plot of land. The group claimed that the area should be used for the construction of social housing. [size=no report]

On 14 September 2020, in Santo Domingo, Valparaiso region, nearly 50 residents protested against the mobility restrictions imposed due to the coronavirus outbreak. The group claimed that the regulation affected their everyday lives, including work. Protesters blocked the bridge that connects the commune with San Antonio. Police dispersed the group. [size=nearly 50]

On 13 September 2020, in the route that connects Collipulli with Angol, Araucania region, a private house and a barn was set on fire by unidentified perpetrators. The victim claimed that she had received threats on the previous days by members of the Mapuche indigenous community and the same plot was occupied and by some Mapuche indigenous people.

On 13 September 2020, in Canete, Biobio region, a group of citizens protested to demand justice in a case of a person killed by suspected indigenous militiamen. The group gathered near the house of the victim and carried candles to demand advances in the police investigation. [size=no report]

On 13 September 2020, in Osorno, Los Lagos region, riots broke out when police attempted to carry out a police control to check a report of domestic violence in an illegal settlement in Rahue Bajo neighbourhood. A group of residents attacked the officers resulting in three officers injured and seven people arrested. [size=at least 7]

On 12 September 2020, in the rural area of Collipulli, Araucania region, members of the Mapuche community occupied a plot of land, claiming it belonged to the indigenous community. Hours later, the police arrived and used tear gas to evict the group. [size=no report]

On 12 September 2020, in Quintero, Valparaiso region, a group of citizens attacked a presumed sexual offender. Police forces intervened and used tear gas to disperse rioters when the group blocked the medical team that was attending the victim. [size=no report]

On 12 September 2020, on Collipulli, Araucania region, one teenager was reported injured in a drive-by shooting by unidentified armed men in a car, in an attack against a group of Mapuche indigenous people who were occupying a private plot of land. The victim was hospitalized due to the severity of the injuries.

On 12 September 2020, near Pailahueque, Araucania region, a group of suspected indigenous militiamen attacked a train operator and set on fire at least two wagons. Perpetrators built a barricade across the railway forcing the machine to stop. Subsequently, they opened fire against workers when these attempted to extinguish the blazes from the railcars. No injuries were reported.

On 12 September 2020, in Pedro Aguirre Cerda, Metropolitana, riots broke out during a funeral as police forces attempted to enforce the no large-gathering law created over the coronavirus pandemic. Police intervened when neighbors reported some shots fired in the air and fireworks. Police arrested 10 people. [size=at least 10]

Around 12 September 2020, in Las Condes, Metropolitana, a group of nearly 300 citizens protested against the implementation of a new constitution in the country. With the constitutional referendum expected to be held on 25 October 2020, a group of citizens gathered near the main square and chanted slogans against the approval. Police arrested three people. [size=nearly 300]

On 11 September 2020, in Ercilla, Araucania region, suspected indigenous militiamen opened fired against two private houses of a recognized industrial farmer. The victim claimed he and his family had to hide under the beds to avoid the impacts. No injuries were reported.

On 11 September 2020, in Valdivia, Los Rios region, a group of citizens demonstrated on the date that marked the 47th anniversary of the military coup that overthrew a democratically elected government. Demonstrators built barricades in different areas of the city. No arrests or further damages were reported. [size=no report]

source: 24 Horas (Chile); El Mercurio (Chile); AFP; Biobio Chile
notes: On 11 September 2020, in Providencia, Metropolitana, dozens of people demonstrated on the date that marked the 47th anniversary of the military coup that overthrew a democratically elected government. Police forces of Chile clashed with demonstrators using tear gas and water cannons when the second blocked nearby streets and started throwing objects to the officers. Additional sources claimed the event also included a group of people that support changes in the constitution. Three officers were reported injured and 14 people were arrested. Another source claimed 17 people were arrested and at least 10 officers were injured. [size=at least 14]

On 11 September 2020, in Recoleta, Metropolitana, nearly 800 citizens demonstrated on the date that marked the 47th anniversary of the military coup that overthrew a democratically elected government. [size=nearly 800]

On 11 September 2020, in San Felipe, Valparaiso region, citizens demonstrated on the date that marked the 47th anniversary of the military coup that overthrew a democratically elected government. On 11 September 2020, in Estacion Central, Metropolitana, citizens demonstrated on the date that marked the 47th anniversary of the military coup that overthrew a democratically elected government. On 11 September 2020, in Huechuraba, Metropolitana, a group of citizens demonstrated on the date that marked the 47th anniversary of the military coup that overthrew a democratically elected government. Demonstrators used Molotov bombs against police forces. [size=no report]

On 11 September 2020, in Vina del Mar, Valparaiso region, citizens protested on the date that marked the 47th anniversary of the military coup that overthrew a democratically elected government. The group gathered near the main square. [size=no report]

On 11 September 2020, in Arica, Arica y Parinacota region, citizens, mostly women, protested on the date that marked the 47th anniversary of the military coup that overthrew a democratically elected government. On 11 September 2020, in the Antofagasta region, citizens demonstrated on the date that marked the 47th anniversary of the military coup that overthrew a democratically elected government. On 11 September 2020, in Osorno, Los Lagos region, citizens protested on the date that marked the 47th anniversary of the military coup that overthrew a democratically elected government. The group gathered near the main square. [size=no report]

On 10 September 2020, in Temuco, Araucania region, a group of citizens and Mapuche indigenous people demonstrated against the construction of a dam in an indigenous reserve area. Around 10 September 2020 (as reported), in Vina del Mar, Valparaiso region, a group of nearly 20 people demonstrated against the construction of a social housing project in the city. The group set on fire one of the backhoes used in the construction. [size=nearly 20]

On 9 September 2020, in Temuco, Araucania region, a group of Mapuche indigenous people demonstrated against a meeting between the government representatives and a group of religious leaders from their community. On 9 September 2020, in Calbuco, Los Lagos region, a group of citizens protested against delays in the construction of a social housing project. The group claimed that the area is already occupied by other families. The group blocked a nearby road for several hours. [size=no report]

On 9 September 2020, in the rural area of Collipulli, Araucania region, a group of suspected indigenous militiamen attacked a group of workers and owners of an industrial farming business. On 8 September 2020, in Lloncao, Biobio region, suspected Mapuche indigenous militiamen set on fire three private houses. Around 8 September 2020, in Providencia, Metropolitana, hundreds of stranded Venezuelan citizens protested to demand support from their embassy to return to their country, since they have been unable to returns since the beginning of the coronavirus pandemic. Police Forces of Chile used tear gas and water cannons to disperse the demonstrators. On 2 September 2020, in the rural area of Tirua, Biobio region, suspected indigenous militiamen opened fire against a police unit that was driving in the km 48 of route P72S. No officers were reported injured.

Around 2 September 2020, in Vina del Mar, Valparaiso region, teachers and parents from a local school protested against the shutdown of the institution. The group reported mismanagement of resources by school administrators and demanded an audit. [size=no report]

On 2 September 2020, in Valparaiso, Valparaiso region, a group of nearly 100 women joined a burial ceremony to protest against a case of sexual and gender violence against a 16-year-old teenager. On 2 September 2020, in Quidico, Biobio region, suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire two private houses. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights. No people were injured in the event.

On 1 September 2020, in Coronel, Biobio region, a group of nearly 30 citizens, including the mayor, protested against the construction of an oil terminal in the commune. On 1 September 2020, in the rural area of Tirua, Biobio region, suspected indigenous militiamen ambushed a police unit. The police vehicle was forced to stop due to a barricade on the road, subsequently, perpetrators opened fire against the officers. No injures were reported.

On 1 September 2020, on Route 5, near Curico, Maule region, a group of truck drivers protested over a spike in attacks on transport trucks. The protest followed a series of arson attacks carried out by suspected indigenous militiamen in the south of the country. The group demanded more police presence on the roads and the approval of a law that increases penalties to people involved in attacks against truck drivers. One protester was killed when a truck driver, who did not take part in the protest, intentionally drove through the group following an argument with the protesters. [size=no report]

actor1: FNPL: Fatherland and Liberty Nationalist Front
notes: Around 1 September 2020, in La Serena, Coquimbo region, suspected Fatherland and Liberty Nationalist Front members destroyed the memorial of an Ecuadorian citizen killed by military forces during the political unrest of October 2019. Pamphlets threatening the family and demanding to stop the legal process against the military forces were found. The documents were signed by the far-right paramilitary organization Fatherland and Liberty Nationalist Front.

The group demanded more police presence on the roads and the approval of a law that increases penalties to people involved in attacks against truck drivers. Protesters gathered together and parked their vehicles alongside the Route 5. [size=nearly 200]

On 28 August 2020, in Providencia, Metropolitana, a group of nearly 150 citizens protested in support of the implementation of a new constitution in the country. On the eve of a referendum to change the current constitution, a group of citizens gathered near the main square and chanted slogans pro-approval. Police used tear gas and water cannons to disperse the group of protesters. 21 people were arrested. [size=nearly 150]

On 28 August 2020, near Puerto Montt, Los Lagos region, a group of truck drivers protested over a spike in attacks on transport trucks. The protest followed a series of arson attacks carried out by suspected indigenous militiamen in the south of the country. The group demanded more police presence on the roads and the approval of a law that increases penalties to people involved in attacks against truck drivers. Protesters blocked the entrance to the city and the freeway for several hours. [size=no report]

On 28 August 2020, in Yeneco, Biobio region, suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire equipment that belonged to a logging company. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights. No injuries were reported.

source: Biobio Chile; La Nacion (Chile); Lider San Antonio
notes: On 27 August 2020, on Route 78, near San Antonio, Valparaiso region, a group of truck drivers demonstrated over a spike in attacks on transport trucks. The event followed a series of arson attacks carried out by suspected indigenous militiamen in the south of the country. The group organized a motorcade in direction to Santiago to demand more police presence on the roads and the approval of a law that increases penalties to people involved in attacks against truck drivers. A second group got involved in a street fight near the port. Police intervened following reports of an armed rioter. [size=no report]

On 27 August 2020, in Canete, Biobio region, a group of nearly 200 people demonstrated to demand the release of arrested Mapuche people. Masked demonstrators attempted to set on fire the offices of the public prosecution and a government agency, moreover, multiple local businesses reported damages. [size=nearly 200]

On 27 August 2020, in Route 68, near Casablanca, Valparaiso region, a group of between 100 to 150 truck drivers demonstrated over a spike in attacks on transport trucks. The demonstration followed a series of arson attacks carried out by suspected indigenous militiamen in the south of the country. The group demanded more police presence on the roads and the approval of a law that increases penalties to people involved in attacks against truck drivers. Drivers used their trucks to intermittently block a lane of the highway. [size=between 100 to 150]

On 27 August 2020, in the rural area of Curacautin, Araucania region, suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire five summer cottages and multiple pieces of equipment near the Talcahuano hot springs. There have been several attacks in the Araucania region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights.

On 27 August 2020, on Route 5, near Talca, Maule region, a group of truck drivers protested over a spike in attacks on transport trucks. The group demanded more police presence on the roads and the approval of a law that increases penalties to people involved in attacks against truck drivers. Protesters drove slowly on the freeway to raise awareness on violence against drivers. [size=no report]

Around 27 August 2020 (as reported), in Villa Alemana, Valparaiso region, a group of citizens, mostly women, protested to demand justice in a case of sexual and gender violence against a 16-year-old teenager. The driver of a car hit two protesters when they drove through the sidewalk to circumvent the demonstration. They were slightly injured. [size=no report]

The group demanded more police presence on the roads and the approval of a law that increases penalties to people involved in attacks against truck drivers. On 26 August 2020, in Antofagasta, Antofagasta region, truck drivers protested over a spike in attacks on transport trucks. The group demanded more police presence on the roads and the approval of a law that increases penalties to people involved in attacks against truck drivers.
