On 26 August 2020, in Nunoa, Metropolitana, a group of citizens protested in support of the implementation of a new constitution in the country. On the eve of a referendum to change the current constitution, a group of citizens gathered near the main square and chanted slogans pro-approval. [size=no report]

On 26 August 2020, in Concepcion, Biobio region, a group of citizens protested over the implementation of a new constitution in the country. With the constitutional referendum expected to be held on 25 October 2020, a group of citizens gathered near the main square and chanted slogans pro-approval. [size=no report]

On 26 August 2020, in the rural area of Lonquimay, Araucania region, suspected indigenous militiamen set two summer cottages on fire near the Galletue Lake. There have been several attacks in the Araucania region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights. Pamphlets demanding the release of arrested Mapuche individuals were found.

Around 26 August 2020, in Alto Hospicio, Tarapaca region, a group of 40 citizens protested against the construction of a social housing project. The group claimed the project forced to shut down nearby roads that communicate their neighborhood with the main areas of the city. [size=40]

Around 26 August 2020, in Temuco, Araucania region, a group of nearly 50 citizens protested in support of the implementation of a new constitution in the country. With the constitutional referendum expected to be held on 25 October 2020, a group of citizens gathered near the main square and chanted slogans pro-approval. [size=nearly 50]

Around 25 August 2020, in Santiago, Metropolitana, a group of nearly 30 women organized a pot-banging protest against a court decision to release on bail a presumed sexual offender. The women demanded justice for the victim. [size=nearly 30]

Around 25 August 2020, in Hualpen, Biobio region, a group of workers of a local company protested against budget cuts inside the firm. The workers fear the process would include staff cutbacks and demanded job security. [size=no report]

On 25 August 2020, in Temuco, Araucania region, a group of nearly 15 women members of the Mapuche indigenous community demonstrated to demand the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. The group occupied the building of a radio station to demand better press coverage of the Mapuche conflict. The group left the building after the radio moderator agreed to read a public statement. Additionally, several barricades were built and set on fire across the city. Pamphlets demanding the release of arrested Mapuche individuals were found nearby. [size=nearly 15]

source: La Estrella Concepcion; Biobio Chile; La Nacion (Chile)
notes: On 25 August 2020, on Route P60, near Contulmo, Biobio region, suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire a truck loaded with supplies. The perpetrators clashed with police forces when this arrived in the area where the arson attack took place. There were no injuries in the attack.

On 25 August 2020, near Los Sauces, Los Rios region, a group of 8 suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire two trucks. The group threatened the drivers before burning down the truck cabins. No fatalities were reported.
On 25 August 2020, near Pidima, Araucania region, suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire a truck. Perpetrators opened fire against the car, injuring the driver.

On 25 August 2020, in the rural area of Freire, Araucania region, suspected indigenous militiamen opened fire against a police unit that was guarding a private plot from a company. No fatalities were reported. There have been several attacks in the Araucania region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights and the release of arrested Mapuche individuals.

On 25 August 2020, on Route T-185, near Lanco, Los Rios region, suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire heavy equipment that belonged to a local company. Pamphlets demanding the release of arrested Mapuche individuals and the return of ancestral land to the communities were found.

Around 25 August 2020, in Santiago, Metropolitana, a group of nearly 150 individuals attacked military and police units that attempted to reinforce the laws created over the coronavirus pandemic. The group threw rocks at the officers. Rioters were performing an evangelical ceremony at the moment of the event. 15 people were arrested. [size=nearly 150]

On 25 August 2020, in Temuco, Araucania region, a group of people demonstrated to demand the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. Demonstrators built and set on fire barricades across the streets and subsequently fled the area after blocking the traffic. [size=no report]

On 25 August 2020, on Route 5, near Temuco, Araucania region, a group of people demonstrated to demand the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. Demonstrators built and set on fire barricades across the Route 5 and subsequently fled the area. Pamphlets demanding the release of arrested Mapuche individuals and the return of ancestral land to the communities were found near the barricade. [size=no report]

Around 24 August 2020 (as reported), in Linares, Maule region, nearly 600 people, mostly women, protested to demand justice in a case of femicide. Hundreds of women marched through the city to the police station to demand justice for the victim. A second group of women staged a small protest in front of the cemetery, the group displayed banners demanding for justice. [size=nearly 600]

On 24 August 2020, in Coronel, Biobio region, more than 10 people demonstrated to demand coronavirus tests for all residents. Demonstrators claimed that a patient hospitalized in one of the centers adapted for coronavirus cases fled the building and broke into several houses during the evening. Demonstrators used logs and tires to block access to the health center for several hours. [size=more than 10]

On 24 August 2020, on Route 5, near Ercilla, Araucania region, a group of 20 suspected indigenous militiamen opened fire against a group of drivers. Perpetrators set barricades on fire to block the freeway. The group clashed against a police patrol that was in the area. Two civilians were hospitalized, but the severity of their injures was not specified by the sources.

Around 24 August 2020 (as reported), in Los Alamos, Biobio region, a group of nearly 16 people protested to demand the dismissal of a school director. The protest was triggered after an audio, in which the director and other workers used pejorative language against the students and some of their families, was leaked to the parents. The group blocked the main access to the building. [size=nearly 16]

On 23 August 2020, in San Bernardo, Metropolitana, a group of people who were protesting in remembrance of an indigenous Mapuche activist killed in 2016 were hit by private car. Six people were reported injured, two of them hospitalized due to the severity of their injuries. [size=at least 6]

On 23 August 2020, in San Juan de La Costa, Los Lagos region, a group of citizens protested against the travel restrictions due to the coronavirus pandemic. The group claimed they haven't been able to check on their holiday houses. Protesters organized a motorcade across several communes to demand access to their properties. [size=no report]

On 22 August 2020, in Quintero, Valparaiso, residents marched in remembrance of 1,500 people who were affected by a massive intoxication in 2018. Over the years, residents have been affected by environmental problems in the area. [size=no report]

On 22 August 2020, in Route Q-182, between Angol and Collipulli, Araucania region, a group of four suspected indigenous militiamen attacked a group of professional truck drivers. Perpetrators opened fire against the cars and set one truck on fire. One child was reported injured by a pellet.

On 22 August 2020, around Quintero, Valparaiso region, residents of the communes of Quintero and Puchancavi protested over lack of control in industrial areas, and high peaks of contamination in their communes. The group gathered together on the commemoration of a massive intoxication reported in 2018 to raise awareness on this problem and demand more regulation for industries. [size=no report]

Around 21 August 2020, in Santiago, Metropolitana, dozens of people gathered at the Plaza Baquedano and staged a pot-banging protest. Police officers arrived and dispersed the protest with water tanks. No injuries reported. The motive of the protest is not reported. [size=dozens]

On 21 August 2020, in Coronel (Concepcion, Biobio) residents protested against the environmental damage in the area. Protesters demanded from the company Bocamina a compensation for the environmental damage caused by the company. [size=no report]

On 21 August 2020, in Providencia, Metropolitana, a group of citizens protested to demand justice for a young that lost his sight due to police brutality. The group chanted slogans against the state and police forces, police officers used water cannons to disperse the group. [size=no report]
On 20 August 2020, in Molina, Maule, a group of people protested against a poultry plant project. Protesters fear for a negative impact on the environment. [size=no report]

On 20 August 2020, in Victoria, Araucania region, a group of nearly 50 people protested over increasing attacks against civilians in the region. The group gathered to show their support to a victim whose building was burned down and the plot of land subsequently occupied. [size=nearly 50]

On 18 August 2020, in Concepcion, Biobio region, a group of citizens protested to demand the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. The group displayed banners with slogans supporting the demands of Mapuche indigenous communities. [size=no report]

On 18 August 2020, in Valdivia, Los Rios, a group of Mapuche people demonstrated outside a real estate company and built barricades, in Los Pellines sector, to demand the release of arrested Mapuche people. Police officers used tear gas to disperse the group. A resident was affected by the tear gas and two officers were injured with pellets. It is unknown how police officers were injured with pellets. [size=no report]

On 17 August 2020, in Mafil, Los Rios, around 30 Mapuche people protested to demand the release of Mapuche people that have been arrested in previous protests. Security forces arrested two Mapuche people. [size=around 30]

On 17 August 2020, in Nueva Imperial, Araucania, around 200 Mapuche people marched and arrived to the Plaza de Armas to demand the release of a group of Mapuche people who are under arrest and hunger strike. [size=around 200]

On 17 August 2020, in Maipu, Metropolitana, riots broke out during a funeral as police forces attempted to enforce the no large-gathering law created over the coronavirus pandemic. Police intervened when neighbors reported some shots fired in the air and fireworks. Police arrested 10 people. [size=at least 10]

On 17 August 2020, in Santiago, Metropolitana, a group of union leaders from Metro S.A. protested at the Baquedano station to reject the dismissal of more than 1,000 workers in the last 3 months. [size=no report]

On 17 August 2020, in the rural area of Loncoche, suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire heavy machineries that belonged to a private company. Perpetrators clashed with police forces while running away the area. There have been several attacks in the Araucania region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights. There are no reports of injuries or fatalities.

On 17 August 2020, in Temuco, Araucania region, a group of nearly 15 women protested over a case of femicide. The group demanded justice for the victim and the re-opening of the police investigation, which was closed in the previous months. [size=nearly 15]

actor2: Police Forces of Chile (2018-) Prison Guards
notes: On 16 August 2020, in Santiago, Metropolitana, at least 5 prisoners demonstrated against increase of police searches inside the prison. New protocols allow guards to carry spontaneous checks. A group of prisoners demonstrated and attacked the guards using knives. [size=at least 5]

On 16 August 2020, in San Felipe, Valparaiso, six people protested in the Cathedral of Valparaiso to express their discontent over the ordination of the new Bishop of San Felipe. Protesters accused the new Bishop of having covert attitudes towards allegations of sexual abuse. [size=6]
On 15 August 2020, in Osorno, Araucania region, a group of 50 citizens and families of missing persons protested on the streets to raise awareness on this problem. [size=50]

On 15 August 2020, in Lota, Concepcion, a group of nearly 100 people and relatives of a young woman, who died in 2018 in the Biobio river, marched to demand justice and transparency in the case. [size=nearly 100]

Around 14 August 2020, in Teno, Maule region, a group of residents protested over improvements of the sewage system. Protesters complained that streets often flood with wastewater and demanded a solution from the local government. [size=no report]

On 14 August 2020, in Concepcion, Biobio region, kindergarten teachers protested over the lack of financial support during the coronavirus pandemic. The group claimed the temporary closure of the schools has affected their income and demanded government measures to mitigate the economic crisis. [size=no report]

On 14 August 2020, in Talcahuano, Biobio region, kindergarten teachers protested over the lack of financial support during the coronavirus pandemic. The group claimed the temporary closure of the schools has affected their income and demanded government measures to mitigate the economic crisis. [size=no report]

On 14 August 2020, in the rural area of Los Alamos, Biobio region, a group of 12 to 16 suspected indigenous militiamen abducted for several hours a worker of a local logging company. The victim was forced into a car and then drove to a private property, where the perpetrators proceeded to burn down several machines. The victim was beaten up and released hours later. Pamphlets demanding the release of arrested Mapuche individuals were found.

On 14 August 2020, in Providencia, Metropolitana, a group of nearly 50 citizens protested to demand the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. Protesters displayed banners with slogans supporting the demands of Mapuche indigenous communities and made a pot-banging protest. Police forces used water cannons to disperse the group. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: Health Workers (Chile); FENATS: National Federation of Health Workers
notes: On 13 August 2020, in Concepcion, Biobio region, a group of health workers affiliated to FENAT protested against the lack of measures to prevent the spread of the coronavirus. The group demands the reinforcement of curfew measures to contain the pandemic and demanded improvements in safety equipment for doctors and nurses. [size=no report]

Around 12 August 2020 (between 12 - 13 August), near Canete, Biobio region, Mapuche indigenous people demonstrated to demand the release of arrested Mapuche individuals and the return of ancestral land to the communities. Demonstrators used large wooden logs to block the road in the area Cayupil. The group was dispersed by police forces. There were reports of violence between officers and demonstrators, but no particular episode was mentioned. [size=no report]

On 12 August 2020, in the rural area of Canete, Biobio region, suspected indigenous militiamen set a summer cottage on fire near the Lanalhue Lake. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights. No fatalities were reported.

On 12 August 2020, in Nueva Imperial, Araucania region, a large group of Mapuche indigenous people protested to demand the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. The group performed a traditional ceremony near the clinic where one of the prisoners is hospitalized due to a enduring hunger strike. [size=a large group]

On 12 August 2020, in Concepcion, Biobio region, a group of Mapuche indigenous people protested to demand the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. The group displayed banners with slogans supporting the demands of Mapuche indigenous communities. [size=no report]

On 11 August 2020, near Llleulleu, Biobio region, a beer-delivery truck was set on fire by a group of suspected indigenous militiamen. The perpetrators threatened the drivers. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights. No people were reported injured or killed.

On 11 August 2020, in the rural areas of Lautaro, Araucania region, Mapuche indigenous people demonstrated to demand the release of Mapuche arrested individuals. The group staged several blockades in the rural routes of the commune. [size=no report]

On 11 August 2020, in Concepcion, Araucania region, Mapuche indigenous people and other citizens staged a demonstration. The group demanded the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. Police Forces used tear gas and water cannons to disperse the group. Police arrested 9 people. [size=at least 9]

On 11 August 2020, in Canete, Araucania region, a group of nearly 200 Mapuche indigenous people staged a demonstration. The group demanded the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. Police Forces used tear gas and water cannons to disperse the group, while demonstrators used rocks against the officers. Police arrested 4 people. [size=nearly 200]

On 11 August 2020, in Route T60 that connects Valdivia and Paillaco, Los Rios region, suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire equipment that belonged to a logging company. There have been several attacks in the Los Rios region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights. No fatalities were reported.

assoc_actor_1: Teachers (Chile); CUT: The Workers' United Center of Chile
notes: Around 11 August 2020, in Colchane, Tarapaca region, teachers affiliated to the CUT protested against the lack of safety equipment to work amid the coronavirus pandemic. Protesters claimed the mayor pushed teachers to continued working without providing the proper equipment. The group gathered near the city hall. [size=no report]

On 11 August 2020, in Punta Arenas, Magallanes region, workers of a company that produces aggregates demonstrated over lack of financial support during the coronavirus pandemic. The group used heavy machinery and trucks to block the streets to access the city to demand government measures to mitigate the economic crisis. The group informed the protest will be held until they get an official answer to their demands. [size=no report]
On 11 August 2020, in Calbuco, Los Lagos region, a group of around 100 citizens protested over a case of hit and run. The group marched demanding justice for the victim. [size=around 100]

On 10 August 2020, on route P60R near Contulmo, Biobio region, a group of indigenous Mapuche people demanded the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. Demonstrators built barricades and blocked the main entrance to the commune. [size=no report]

On 10 August 2020, in Villa Alemana, Valparaiso region, a group of citizens, mostly women, protested to demand justice in a case of sexual and gender violence against a 16-year-old teenager. Protesters gathered near the tribunal building during the preliminary hearing session. [size=no report]

On 10 August 2020, in Contulmo, Biobio region, nearly 50 Mapuche indigenous people protested against declaration of the commune mayor's. The group claimed the politician made racist remarks over the Mapuche protests. The group gathered near the town hall. [size=nearly 50]

On 10 August 2020, in Providencia, Metropolitan, a group of women marched to demand women's rights and stronger sentences for cases of gender violence. Police forces dispersed the group. [size=no report]

On 10 August 2020, in Quilpue, Valparaiso region, hundreds of citizens protested to demand justice in a case of sexual and gender violence against a 16-year-old teenager. Hundreds of women marched through the city. [size=hundreds]

On 10 August 2020, in Valdivia, Los Rios region, truck drivers protested over lack of security to work in the freeways and rural roads of the southern regions. The group organized a motorcade of vehicles through the city. Protesters demanded more police control and stronger sentences to people who attack trucks, insisting that arsons attacks increased over the last months. [size=at least 40]

On 10 August 2020, near Angol, Araucania region, a group of suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire two trucks and machinery that belonged to a company dedicated to the extraction of aggregates. The armed men forced workers out of the area, tied them up, and then proceed to burned down the vehicles, in Balneario El Huaso. Pamphlets demanding the release of arrested Mapuche individuals and the return of ancestral land to the communities were found. No fatalities were reported.

On 10 August 2020, in the rural area of Canete, Biobio region, suspected indigenous militiamen burned down the house of a local farmer. Authorities suspect the attack is related to an indigenous militia group since the owner received threats over the lasts weeks. No fatalities were reported.

On 10 August 2020, on Route 5 near Puerto Montt, Los Lagos region, nearly 20 truck drivers protested over lack of security to work in the freeways and rural roads of the southern regions. The group parked their trucks at the roadside to demand more police control and stronger sentences to people that attack trucks, insisting that arsons attacks increased over the last months. A second report claimed that more than 100 truck drivers took part in the protest. [size=nearly 20]

On 10 August 2020, in Providencia, Metropolitana, a group of nearly 10 people protested in support of the Mapuche indigenous communities. The group displayed banners with slogans supporting the demands of Mapuche indigenous communities. Police forces arrested two people. [size=nearly 10]

On 10 August 2020, in Concepcion, Araucania region, truck drivers protested over lack of security to work in the freeways and rural roads of the southern regions. The group organized a motorcade of nearly 40 vehicles that drove through the city. Protesters demand more police control and stronger sentences to people who attack trucks, insisting that arsons attacks increased over the last months. [size=nearly 40 vehicles]

On 10 August 2020, in Temuco, Araucania region, nearly 40 truck drivers demonstrated over lack of security to work in the freeways and rural roads of the southern regions. The group used the trucks to block access to the city. Demonstrators demand more police control and stronger sentences to people that attack trucks, insisting that arsons attacks increased over the last months. [size=nearly 40]

On 10 August 2020, in Santiago, Metropolitana, a group of 5 people protested in support of the Mapuche indigenous communities. The group displayed banners with slogans supporting the demands of Mapuche indigenous communities. Police forces arrested the group. [size=5]

On 10 August 2020, near Calbuco, Los Lagos region, truck drivers protested over lack of security to work in the highways and rural roads of the southern regions. The group parked their trucks at the roadside to demand more police control and stronger sentences to people that attack trucks, insisting that arsons attacks increased over the last months. [size=no report]

On 10 August 2020, on the route P60R that connects Canete and Alamos, Biobio region, a group of indigenous Mapuche people demanded the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. Demonstrators built barricades and block the traffic. The group displayed banners with slogans supporting the demands of Mapuche indigenous communities.[size=no report]

On 9 August 2020, in Huentelolen, Biobio region, a group of suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire a pick-up truck that belonged to a logging company. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights. No people were reported injured or killed.

On 9 August 2020, in the rural area of Lautaro, Araucania, suspected indigenous militiamen burned down the house of a local farmer. Authorities suspect the event is related to an arson attack since the house was empty and without energy service when the event was reported.

On 9 August 2020, in Curacautin, Araucania region, Mapuche indigenous people demonstrated to demand the release of arrested Mapuche individuals and the return of ancestral land to the communities. Demonstrators and police officers clashed when the first ones began throwing rocks at the officer, barricades were built across the roads to enter the commune. Several private houses and businesses were destroyed. One police officer was reported injured. [size=no report]

Around 9 August 2020 (weekend of), in Valdivia, Los Lagos region, a group of citizens protested over the protection of a natural area in the commune. The group demanded that the government declare the wetland a natural reserve. [size=no report]

On 9 August 2020, in Tirua, Biobio region, a group of suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire a private house in the north of the commune. According to the victim, the perpetrators force the lock and then proceed to used gasoline to burned down the house. No fatalities were reported. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights and the release of arrested Mapuche individuals.

On 8 August 2020, on the route that connects Contulmo and Canete, Biobio region, a delivery truck was set on fire by a group of suspected indigenous militiamen. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights. No people were reported injured or killed.

On 8 August 2020, in Malvilla, Valparaiso region, nearly 100 truck drivers protested over the poor working condition of drivers. The group demanded improvements in the contracts and job stability. Additionally, the union demanded more security for those drivers who work in the south of the country following an increase of arson attacks. They organized a motorcade to the city of San Antonio. [size=nearly 100]

On 8 August 2020, near Mulchen, Biobio region, a group of indigenous Mapuche people demanded the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. Demonstrators used rocks to built barricades and block the traffic. [size=no report]

On 8 August 2020, near Pitrufquen, Biobio region, a group of indigenous Mapuche people demanded the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. Demonstrators used rocks to built barricades and block the traffic in Route 5. The group displayed banners with slogans supporting the demands of Mapuche indigenous communities. [size=no report]

On 7 August 2020, near Trosco, Los Lagos region, Mapuche indigenous people demonstrated to demand the release of arrested Mapuche individuals and the return of ancestral land to the communities. Demonstrators used large wooden logs to block the road u-400 and U-220. [size=no report]

On 7 August 2020, in Purranque, Los Lagos region, suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire heavy machinery and other vehicles that belonged to a forest plantation company. Pamphlets connecting the attack to the CAM were found in the area.

On 7 August 2020, in Lumaco, Araucania region, Mapuche indigenous people demonstrated to demand the release of arrested Mapuche individuals and the return of ancestral land to the communities. A group of demonstrators destroyed a statue in honor of a military general and threw the bust into the local river. [size=no report]

On 7 August 2020, in Capitan Pastene, Araucania, suspected indigenous militiamen attempted to burn down the house of a recognized businessman and owner of a logging company. The victim declared that he and his family had received multiple threats previous to the attack. No fatalities were reported.

On 7 August 2020, in Valdivia, Los Rios region, a group of nearly 50 citizens protested delays in the construction of a social housing project. The group staged a small gathering and demanded to expedite the construction process. [size=nearly 50]

On 7 August 2020, in Nueva Imperial, Araucania region, Mapuche indigenous people protested against the construction of high voltage towers in their territory. The group claimed the project did not include prior consultation with the communities or residents. [size=no report]

On 7 August 2020, Santiago, Metropolitana, a mob attacked a person accused of stealing objects from private cars. The victim was severely beaten and tighten to a nearby bus station by a group of rioters. Police forces intervened to protect the victim. [size=no report]

On 7 August 2020, in Limache, Valparaiso region, a group of citizens demonstrated to demand justice in a case of sexual and gender violence against a 16-year-old teenager. The group attempted to beat up the mother of the victim, who is considered an accomplice in the crime. Demonstrators broke into the private house and set on fire the belongings of the woman. Police intervened to protect the woman. [size=no report]

On 7 August 2020, near Los Angeles, Biobio region, truck drivers protested over lack of security to work in the highways and rural roads of the southern region of the country. The group blocked Route 5 between Los Angeles and Mulchen to demand more police control, insisting that arsons attacks increased over the last months. [size=no report]

On 7 August 2020, in Osorno, Los Lagos region, a group of Mapuche indigenous people protested to demand the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. Protesters gathered in the main square of the city and blocked the traffic for several minutes. [size=no report]

On 7 August 2020, near Lumaco, Araucania region, Mapuche indigenous people protested to demand the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. The group blocked the route R90 for several hours. [size=no report]

On 7 August 2020, in Vina del Mar, Valparaiso region, a group of citizens demonstrated to demand justice in a case of sexual and gender violence against a 16-year-old teenager. The group gathered near the police station in which the suspect was arrested. Police forces arrested an undetermined number of protesters for breaking the quarantine measures due to coronavirus outbreak. [size=no report]

On 7 August 2020, in Villa Alemana, Valparaiso region, a group of citizens protested to demand justice in a case of sexual and gender violence against a 16-year-old teenager. Citizens marched through the commune. [size=no report]

On 6 August 2020, in Lumaco, Araucania region, a group of more than 100 Mapuche people protested to demand the release of arrested Mapuche individuals and the return of ancestral land to the communities. The group took a building from a government agency and blocked nearby streets for a couple of hours. [size=more than 100]

On 6 August 2020, in Huechuraba, Metropolitana, a group of 30 people demonstrated to demand justice in a case of sexual and gender violence against a 16-year-old teenager. The group attack a police station in the commune. [size=30]

On 6 August 2020, in Tirua, Araucania region, police forces evicted a group of nearly 100 Mapuche indigenous people who occupied the city hall building the night before. The group demanded the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. 3 people were arrested. [size=nearly 100]

On 6 August 2020, in Quidico, Araucania region, suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire two private houses. Indigenous Mapuche called for more drastic measures after police forces evicted a group of protesters from the town hall in Tirua earlier that day. No fatalities were reported.

On 6 August 2020, in the rural area of Tirua, Araucania region, suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire a truck. Indigenous Mapuche called for more drastic measures after police forces evicted a group of protesters from the town hall in Tirua earlier that day, who demanded the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. No fatalities were reported.

On 6 August 2020, near Tirua, Araucania region, Mapuche indigenous people blocked the road P-70 with barricades to demand the release of arrested Mapuche individuals and land rights for indigenous communities of the country. The blockage followed a call for more drastic measures after police forces evicted a group of demonstrators, who demanded the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. [size=no report]

On 6 August 2020, in Recoleta, Metropolitana, a group of nearly 30 citizens demonstrated to demand justice in a case of sexual and gender violence against a 16-year-old teenager. The group burned down a bus of public service and used homemade weapons against the officers, while police used tear gas and water cannons to disperse the group. A second report claimed nearly 100 people took part in the demonstration. [size=nearly 30]

On 6 August 2020, in Villa Alemana, Valparaiso region, a group of citizens protested to demand justice in a case of sexual and gender violence against a 16-year-old teenager. Protesters gathered near the house were the perpetrator reportedly lives. Additionally, other groups staged pot-banging protests from their windows. [size=no report]

On 6 August 2020, in Angol, Araucania region, a group of Mapuche people protested near the local jail to demand the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. Police forces dispersed the group and destroyed structures built by protesters to protect them from the cold weather. [size=no report]

On 6 August 2020, in Santiago, Metropolitana, a group of citizens protested to demand justice in a case of sexual and gender violence against a 16-year-old teenager. Residents of the commune staged a pot-banging protest. [size=no report]

On 6 August 2020, in Limache, Valparaiso region, a group of citizens, mostly women, demonstrated to demand justice in a case of sexual and gender violence against a 16-year-old teenager. A large group continued demonstrating in front of the police station for several hours. [size=a large group]

On 6 August 2020, in Quilpue, Valparaiso region, a group of citizens protested to demand justice in a case of sexual and gender violence against a 16-year-old teenager. Citizens organized a pot-banging protest in the commune. [size=no report]

On 5 August 2020, in Tirua, Biobio region, a group of nearly 100 Mapuche people protested to demand the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. The group took over the offices of the town hall to protest. [size=nearly 100]

On 5 August 2020, in Plon Maquehue, Araucania region, a group of suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire machinery and other equipment from a company dedicated to the extraction of aggregates. Perpetrator burned down 18 trucks, two backhoe, and the local offices. Pamphlets connecting the attack to the WAM were found in the area.

On 5 August 2020, in Valdivia, Los Rios region, a group of nearly 50 Mapuche people protested to demand the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. A group of 20 Mapuche occupied the offices of a government agency for 6 hours, while outside the building a second group of nearly 30 people displayed banners with slogans supporting the demands of Mapuche indigenous communities. [size=nearly 50]

On 5 August 2020, in the rural area of Traiguen, Araucania region, a group of suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire a backhoe that belonged to a Mapuche religious leader. The victim has been accused by some members of the community of carrying negotiations between government officials without the approval of the indigenous community.

Around 5 August 2020 (week of), in Quisco, Valparaiso region, a mob attacked a person that reportedly broke into a private store to stole goods. The victim was severely beaten by the store owners and other residents, before being arrested by police forces. [size=no report]

Around 5 August 2020 (week of), in the Los Rios region, workers of the regional Ministry of Public Health stopped activities and staged a demonstration to protest over alleged political favors inside the institution. Workers claimed bribes are used to keep individual stores open despite the coronavirus pandemic. The group demanded reforms and more transparency from the department managers regarding the management of coronavirus restrictions. [size=no report]

source: El Austral Temuco; El Austral Osorno; La Nacion (Chile)
notes: On 4 August 2020, in Lumaco, Araucania region, police forces and Mapuche indigenous people clashed in a demonstration. Demonstrators demanded the release of arrested Mapuche individuals and land rights for indigenous communities of the country. Police used tear gas and water cannons to disperse the group, while a second report accounts that demonstrators attacked the police station. Ten people were reported injured, among them 5 police officers. [size=at least 5]

source: El Austral Temuco; El Austral Osorno; Biobio Chile
notes: On 4 August 2020, in Temuco, Araucania region, nearly 300 demonstrators demanded the release of arrested Mapuche individuals and land rights for indigenous communities of the country. The group blocked the streets for several hours. Police used tear gas and water cannons to disperse the group. 11 people were arrested. [size=nearly 300]

Around 4 August 2020, in Cartagena, Valparaiso region, a group of citizens demonstrated in support of the Mapuche communities. The group gathered together following reports of clashes between residents and Mapuche activists in other areas of the country, the group also demanded the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. Police forces clashed against demonstrators when the second one attack police vehicle with rocks and built barricades to block the traffic. Four people were arrested. [size=at least 4]

Around 4 August 2020, in the rural area of Padre Las Casas, Araucania region, suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire a truck. Perpetrators threatened the driver with guns, before setting the vehicle on fire. According to the driver, militiamen opened fire against the victim. No fatalities/injured were reported.

On 3 August 2020, in Canete, Biobio region, a group of citizens demonstrated in support of the Mapuche communities. The group gathered together following reports of clashes between residents and Mapuche activists in other areas of the country. The group also demanded the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. Police forces clashed against demonstrators. Some private businesses reported damages. [size=no report]

Around 3 August 2020, in Providencia, Metropolitana region, a group of dozens of Haitian citizens protested near the consulate over the lack of support to return to their country. The group, mostly economic migrants, lost their jobs in the country due to the coronavirus pandemic and demanded a humanitarian flight. [size=dozens]

On 3 August 2020, in Talca, Maule region, a motorcade of taxis drivers protested over lack of financial support during the coronavirus pandemic. The group drove through the city. Protesters blocked the streets for several minutes. Police arrested 3 people. [size=at least 3]

On 3 August 2020, in Concepcion, Biobio region, police forces of Chile dispersed a protest organized by Mapuche indigenous people. Demonstrators demanded the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. No arrests were reported. [size=no report]

On 3 August 2020, on Route 5 near Ercilla, Araucania region, a group of indigenous Mapuche demanded the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. Demonstrators set on fire barricades across the highway. [size=no report]

On 3 August 2020, in Collipulli, Araucania region, a group of citizens demonstrated in support of the Mapuche communities. The group gathered together following reports of clashes between residents and Mapuche activists in other areas of the country. Demonstrators set on fire a truck and vandalized the offices of the local public prosecutors. The group also demanded the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. Police Forces used tear gas and water cannons to disperse the group. Five people were arrested. [size=at least 5]

On 3 August 2020, in Lonquimay, Araucania region, a group of nearly 100 citizens protested in support of the Mapuche communities. The group gathered together following reports of clashes between residents and Mapuche activists in other areas of the country. The group performed a traditional Mapuche ceremony in the city center and subsequently blocked the traffic for several minutes. There were reports of police and military units in the area, but no intervention was reported. [size=nearly 100]

On 3 August 2020, in Osorno, Los Lagos region, police forces of Chile dispersed a protest organized by Mapuche indigenous people. Protesters demanded the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. There were no reports of violence by protesters, six people were arrested. [size=at least 6]

On 3 August 2020, in the rural area of Ercilla, Araucania region, suspected indigenous militiamen and Police Forces of Chile clashed near the Collico area. There have been several attacks in the Araucania region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights. One police officer was injured.

On 3 August 2020, in the Araucania region, military forces of Chile reported the deployment of military troops to protect the traffic along Route 5. The actions followed a series of arson attacks carried by suspected indigenous militiamen.

On 2 August 2020, in the rural area of Collipulli, Araucania region, firefighters reported that suspected indigenous militiamen opened fire against the group when these were attending an emergency called for a fire of a summer cottage in the area. No fatalities were reported.

On 2 August 2020, in Victoria, Araucania region, a group of rioters clashed with Mapuche indigenous people who occupied the city hall to demand the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. On 1 August 2020, in Curacautin, Araucania region, a group of nearly 400 rioters clashed with Mapuche indigenous people who took the city hall to demonstrate and demand the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. On 1 August 2020, in the rural area of Collipulli, Araucania region, a group of suspected indigenous militiamen cut down at least 52 threes from a three plant. The owner claimed the attack represents a substantial economic loss for his company. No people were reported injured or killed.

On 31 July 2020, in Concepcion, Biobio region, nearly 100 drivers of public buses and taxis from Concepcion, Lota, Coronel, and other communes, protested over lack of financial support during the coronavirus pandemic. The group marched through the city to demand government measures to mitigate the economic crisis. [size=nearly 100]

notes: On 31 July 2020, in Lota, Biobio region, drivers of public buses and taxis demonstrated over lack of financial support during the coronavirus pandemic. Police forces intervened in the demonstration, when drivers used their buses to block the road. Police arrested 10 people. [size=at least 10]

On 31 July 2020, in Maipu, Metropolitana, a group of residents demonstrated over the increasing insecurity in the area. The group blocked the traffic with barricades to demand more police in the neighborhood and the regulation of illegal settlements. [size=no report]

On 30 July 2020, in the rural area of Pidima, Araucania region, Mapuche indigenous militia men sabotaged a railway and opened fire against the train engineer. Pamphlets demanding the release of arrested Mapuche individuals and the return of ancestral land to the communities were found. The attack caused the derailment of a locomotive. The train operator was reported with small injuries.

On 30 July 2020, in Pidima, Araucania region, suspected indigenous militiamen opened fire against a police unit. The officers were guarding a private property in the area when the clash started. There were not reports of people injured or killed.

On 30 July 2020, in Ercilla, Araucania region, a group of Mapuche people protested to demand the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. The group took over the offices of the town hall for several hours to protest. [size=no report]

On 30 July 2020, in Victoria, Araucania region, a group of rioters attacked with objects a police unit that was patrolling the commune. One officer was injured due to the impact of a can of paint. [size=no report]

Around 30 July 2020, in San Antonio, Valparaiso region, a group of citizens and members of the No+AFP group protested over general discontent with the government. The group marched on the streets of the city to demand improvements in the pension system. [size=no report]

Around 29 July 2020, in Providencia, Metropolitana region, a group of Venezuelan citizens protested over the lack of support to return to their country. The group got stranded after several countries shut down their borders due to the coronavirus pandemic. The group demanded a humanitarian flight near the consulate. [size=no report]

On 29 July 2020, in Rancagua, O'Higgins region, police forces of Chile stopped and finned the drivers of a motorcade of at least 37 drivers of public buses and taxis. The group, originally from the Biobio region, drove across the country in direction to Santiago to protest over lack of financial support during the coronavirus pandemic. A second report claimed 56 drivers took part in the demonstration. [size=at least 37]

On 29 July 2020, in the rural area of Carahue, Araucania region, a group of suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire an aerial radar that belonged to the route traffic control center of the local airport. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights.

On 29 July 2020, in Panguipulli, Los Rios region, a group of nearly 30 Mapuche people demonstrated to demand the release of arrested Mapuche individuals and the return of ancestral land to the communities. The group took a building from a government agency for several hours. [size=nearly 30]

On 29 July 2020, in Reputo, Biobio region, suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire heavy equipment that belonged to a local logging company. Perpetrators threatened the workers with guns, before setting the equipment on fire. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights. No people were reported injured or killed.

On 29 July 2020, on the rural area of Canete, Biobio region, equipment that belonged to a logging company was set on fire by a group of suspected indigenous militiamen. There have been several attacks in the Araucania region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights. No people were reported injured or killed.

On 29 July 2020, in Puerto Montt, Los Lagos region, citizens protested over a case of a disappeared woman. The family of the victim and other citizens demanded more advances in the police investigation and justice for the victim. [size=no report]

On 29 July 2020, in Temuco, Araucania region, a group of nearly 1,000 Mapuche people and other citizens protested to demand the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. Protesters gathered in the main square of the city. [size=nearly 1,000]

On 29 July 2020, in Labranza, Araucania region, a group of nearly 10 Mapuche indigenous people demanded the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. The group blocked the road for several hours. [size=nearly 10]

On 29 July 2020, in San Antonio, Valparaiso region, a group of environmental activists protested against the construction of a port in a natural reserve area. The group demanded more information and prior consultation with the community before executing the construction. [size=no report]

On 29 July 2020, on Route Q-85 near Mulchen, Araucania region, two trucks were set on fire by a group of suspected indigenous militiamen. There have been several attacks in the Araucania region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights. No people were reported injured or killed.

On 29 July 2020, in Valparaiso, Valparaiso region, a group of citizens protested over the lack of support from the government to built their houses after a fire destroyed a portion of the city in 2014. People affected by the wildfire demanded financial assistance. [size=no report]

Around 29 July 2020, in the rural area of Collipulli, Araucania region, suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire a hotel near the Route 5. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights.

On 29 July 2020, in Osorno, Los Lagos region, a group of Mapuche people protested to demand the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. Protesters gathered in the main square of the city. [size=no report]

On 28 July 2020, in Linares, Maule region, a group of nearly 100 citizens protested over the poor infrastructure of a local road. The group blocked the road and demanded better streetlights among other improvements. [size=nearly 100]

On 28 July 2020, in Linares, Maule region, a group of women protested over the slow investigation in a case of femicide. The group demanded justice for the victims and the appointment of a new prosecutor for the case. [size=no report]

On 28 July 2020, in San Ernesto, Biobio region, suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire heavy equipment that belonged to a local logging company. Perpetrators threatened the workers with guns, before setting the equipment on fire. Pamphlets from the CAM demanding the release of arrested Mapuche individuals were found in the area.

On 28 July 2020, near Talca, Maule region, a motorcade of at least 37 drivers of public buses and taxis protested over lack of financial support during the coronavirus pandemic. A second report claimed 56 drivers took part in the demonstration. [size=at least 37]

On 28 July 2020, in Pitrufquen, Araucania region, a group of nearly 30 people protested against a local politician accused of sexual misconduct. The group interrupted a council meeting to demand the resignation of the representative. [size=nearly 30]
Around 28 July 2020, in Quilpue, Valparaiso region, a group of residents protested against a group of nine people that attempted to build an illegal settlement in a private plot. [size=no report]

On 27 July 2020, in Curacautin, Araucania region, a group of Mapuche people protested to demand the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. The group took over the offices of the town hall for at least 2 days to protest. [size=no report]

notes: On 27 July 2020, in Temuco, Araucania region, a group of Mapuche people demonstrated to demand the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. [size=at least 11]

On 27 July 2020, in Concepcion, Biobio region, citizens demonstrated against the deficit of social housing programs in the district. The group claims there is a lack of political will to support families that do not own a house. Demonstrators built and set on fire barricades across the streets. Police forces dispersed the group, no arrests were reported. [size=no report]

Around 26 July 2020 (as reported), in Coquimbo, Coquimbo region, sellers protested over the lack of control of products offered in the local market. The group claimed that police overlooks the quality of food products distributed by some sellers and demanded more regulation of local markets with a pot-banging protest. [size=no report]

On 26 July 2020, in Llolleo, Valparaiso region, a group of citizens rioted against a man accused of to sexually abusing a girl. The group looted and subsequently set on fire the house of the suspect. [size=no report]

On 25 July 2020, in Providencia, Metropolitan, a group of nearly 25 people organized a motorcade against the potential implementation of a new constitution. In the wake of a call for a national plebiscite, citizens gathered to show their disapproval. [size=nearly 25]

Around 25 July 2020, in Panguipulli, Los Rios region, a group of at least 3 citizens protested over the poor conditions of the food provided by the government in the emergency assistance box. The group displayed a canvas with a slogan against the government during an inaugural ceremony performed by a congresswoman. There have been several reports of expired groceries provided amid the coronavirus crisis. Two men were arrested. [size=at least 3]

On 24 July 2020, in Llico, Biobio region, suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire the house of the guard of a local forest company. There have been several attacks in the Araucania region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights. No people were reported injured or killed.

On 24 July 2020, in the rural area of Nueva Imperial, Araucania region, a suspected indigenous group set on fire heavy equipment that belonged to a local company. Pamphlets demanding the release of arrested Mapuche individuals and the return of ancestral land to the communities were found.

On 24 July 2020, in Valdivia, Los Rios region, hundreds of citizens and members of feminist organizations staged a protest to celebrate the overturning of a court ruling which had rejected the pre-trial detention to a man accused of sexual offenses against several women. A group gathered near the local jail to demand justice for the victims, while a second group staged a protest in the city center. Police arrested nine people in reference to the non-large gathering laws due to the coronavirus pandemic. [size=hundreds]

Around 24 July 2020 (as reported), in Colina, Metropolitana, a female member of the military forces of Chile reported being sexually assaulted by a sergeant in charge of the medical offices of the brigade. The victim was a patient at the moment of the attack and was under the effect of medication. Sources claimed the officer has several open investigations for sexual misconduct against other members of the army.

On 24 July 2020, in Huechuraba, Metropolitana, nearly 60 demonstrators attacked a police station. Sources did not mention the motives for the demonstration but over the week several groups demonstrated against the government. Two people were arrested. [size=nearly 60]

On 24 July 2020, in Curaco, Araucania region, Mapuche indigenous people demanded the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. The group blocked the road for several hours. One police officer was reported injured when a unit attempted to disperse the group. Three people were arrested. [size=at least 3]

On 24 July 2020, on Route R-49 near Collipulli, Araucania region, two trucks were set on fire by a group of suspected indigenous militiamen. There have been several attacks in the Araucania region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights. No people were reported injured or killed.

Around 24 July 2020, in Curico, Maule region, a group of citizens protested over the lack of government support and food assistance to families affected by the coronavirus pandemic. The group demanded the distribution of food supplies for residents. [size=no report]

On 23 July 2020, on a rural road near Canete, Biobio region, a group of suspected indigenous militiamen blocked the traffic in the area for several hours. Witnesses reported that the group was heavily armed and wore bullet-proof vests, among other military gear. The perpetrators opened fire against some of the vehicles that were transiting the area. One civilian was reported injured by a gunshot.

On 23 July 2020, in the rural area of Lautaro, Araucania region, suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire a tractor and the main residence of an agricultural property. On 23 July 2020, in Renca, Metropolitana, a group of rioters attacked with rocks and other objects a police unit who were in the area carrying an anti-drug operation. On 23 July 2020, near Cholchol, Araucania region, suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire two buses. On 16 April 2020, in the rural area of Carahue, Araucania region, a truck of a logging company was set on fire by a group of armed men. Perpetrators threatened the driver with guns, before setting the vehicle on fire. There have been several attacks in the Araucania region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights. The group demanded the release of a Mapuche activist during the attack. No people were reported injured or killed.

On 15 April 2020, in Rancagua, O'Higgins region, a group of prisoners started a riot inside the local jail. The inmates set on fire several objects and attacked the guards with knives. The reason behind the riot was a confiscation carried by prison officers. 3 police officers were reported injured. [size=no report]

On 15 April 2020, in the rural area of Traigen, Araucania region, a group of 20 armed men clashed against the police forces of Chile. Police officers were guarding a group of workers of a local logging company when they were ambushed. Two civilians were reported injured. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies.

On 15 April 2020, in Coronel, Biobio region, more than 20 families of prisoners of a local penitentiary protested over the decision of shutting it down. This implied the transfer of the prisoners to other jails in the region. The group demanded their right to visit their relatives. [size=more than 20 families]

On 14 April 2020, in the rural area of Tirua, Biobio region, an armed man attacked a group of civilians that were conducting a medical checkpoint for coronavirus near the urban area of the district. The perpetrator opened fired against the civilians, injuring two people.

On 14 April 2020, on San Pedro de La Paz, Biobio region, bus drivers demonstrated over lack of financial support during the coronavirus pandemic. The group claimed the low flow of passengers has affected their income. The group blocked the railway for several hours [size=no report]

On 14 April 2020, in El Tabo, Valparaiso region, a group of nearly 20 citizens protested over the lack of a mayor in the district. The group claimed the municipality does not have a designated mayor for more than a month, the former mayor was removed due to corruption allegations. [size=nearly 20]

As reported on 14 April 2020, in the border crossing of Arica, Arica y Parinacota region, police forces of Chile and Military forces of Peru clashed. The incident happened as Chilean police forces were trying to stop a person from illegally crossing the border and entering Peru near the Hito 14. No information on fatalities or injuries was reported/shared by the source. In Chile, citizens of Bolivia and Peru were affected by border shutdowns declared due to the coronavirus pandemic, leaving several people stranded in the border regions.

On 14 April 2020, in Coquimbo, Coquimbo region, a group of 25 people attempted to violently evict a group of salesmen of the local market. The property is currently in a lawsuit to determine ownership. Salesmen reported that the men attacked the security guard and police denied to intercede in the event, reported as unauthorized. [size=25]

On 14 April 2020, in Concepcion, Biobio region, sellers demonstrated against a prohibition of street sales in the city amid coronavirus pandemic. The group built and set on fire barricades in one of the main avenues of the city. [size=no report]

On 14 April 2020, Coronel, Biobio region, bus drivers demonstrated over lack of financial support during the coronavirus pandemic. The group claimed the low flow of passengers has affected their income. The group blocked the railway for several hours [size=no report]

On 13 April 2020, in Antofagasta, Antofagasta region, a group of 20 rioters attacked a group of police officers that was carrying a police investigation in an urban area of the city. On 13 April 2020, in Arica, Arica y Parinacota region, a group of nearly 100 Peruvian citizens protested over the lack of resources for people stranded in the border crossing between Chile and Peru. On 13 April 2020, in Arica, Arica y Parinacota region, workers of a company that cleans green areas in the city protested over the lack of payment of their salaries. The group reported that one of their colleagues was fired after demanding the payment of due wages. [size=no report]

notes: On 13 April 2020, in the rural area of Tirua, Biobio region, members of the Mapuche Lavkenche Resistance (RMP) and police forces clashed. The RMP ambushed a police patrol and activated a car bomb to destroy a bridge that connects the municipalities of Tirua and Canete. Another explosion affected the energy service in the district of Tirua. The group is against the operation of logging companies in the area and repudiate Mapuche leaders who negotiate with such companies. No information on fatalities or injuries was reported/shared by the source.

On 12 April 2020, in Cerro Navia, Metropolitan region, a group of demonstrators clashed with members of Police Forces of Chile during a demonstration over general discontent with the Chilean government. On 6 March 2020, in Santiago, Metropolitan region, students demonstrated over general discontent with the government. The group's demands included reforms in education, healthcare, and pension policies, among other things. Students and Police forces clashed, with the first ones using Molotov bombs against state forces. Police used tear gas to dispersed the group. Meanwhile, other groups jumped metro stations turnstiles and sat near the railways to stop the trains. Several metro stations were forced to stop operations, collapsing the public transport in the Metropolitan area. [size=no report]

On 6 March 2020, in Providencia, Metropolitan region, a small group of people demonstrated over general discontent with the government. Demonstrators used Molotov bombs to set on fire a police car. 8 police officers and 17 demonstrators were reported injured. One person died due to traumatic brain injuries, according to witnesses, by a tear gas canister shot by police forces. 10 people were arrested. [size=at least 27]

notes: On 4 March 2020, in Puente Alto, Metropolitan region, a group of nearly 400 citizens demonstrated over general discontent with the government. The group's demands included reforms in education, healthcare, and pension policies, among other things. A group of rioters built barricades and set on fire two buses of public service; while a reduce group of rioters looted two local stores. Demonstrators and Police Forces clashed in different areas of the district resulting in two officers injured. Several metro stations closed during the episode. Police arrested 16 people. According to a second source, most of the demonstrators were students that took part in nationwide demonstrations organized by ACES and CONES. [size=nearly 400]

On 27 February 2020, in Vitacura, Metropolitan region an unidentified armed group set and exploded two improvised explosives in a local coffee shop. The devices were activated with half an hour of difference to injure police officers that were present in the area after the first explosion. The anarchist group Revolutionary Armed Similarities (Afinidades Armadas en Revuelta) claimed responsibility for the explosion. No information on fatalities or injuries was reported/shared by the source.

assoc_actor_2: Christian Group (Chile); PCC: Communist Party of Chile
notes: On 27 February 2020, in Osorno, Los Lagos region, two people used Molotov bombs to attack a meeting organized in a local church by a member of the Communist Party of Chile. Police Forces of Chile clashed with different groups of rioters. The demonstrators' demands include improvements in education, healthcare and pension policies, among other things. [size=nearly 80,000]

A group of masked people attacked state buildings. Police Forces used tear gas to dispersed the group. Police reported 27 people arrested and eight police officers injured. [size=more than 2,000]

On 19 October 2019, in Copiapo (Atacama), more than 1,000 citizens demonstrated over a general discontent with the government and against the emergency state that allowed military forces of Chile to patrol the streets of the country's capital. Rioters and Police Forces clashed when the latter attempted to disperse the group with tear gas. Several establishments, as well as public infrastructure, were looted and set on fire throughout the afternoon and night. [size=more than 1,000]

On 19 October 2019, in San Miguel, Metropolitan region, demonstration called by students over a rise in the metro ticket turned in demonstrations over general discontent with the government. Groups of citizens took the streets demanding changes in the social and political system in the country. A group of rioters attacked the police station. [size=no report]

On 19 October 2019, the mayor of the city of Concepcion, Biobio region, reported a state of emergency in the regional capital, allowing the Military Forces of Chile to intervene in the demonstrations that are taking place in the streets. A curfew was implemented following the demonstrations in the city.

On 19 October 2019, in San Antonio, Valparaiso region, more than 2,000 citizens and harbor workers demonstrated over a general discontent with the government and against the emergency state that allowed military forces of Chile to patrol the streets of the country's capital. A group of rioters clashed against Police Forces of Chile. The group threw rocks and other objects to police officers which reacted with tear gas and water hoses. Rioters set a supermarket and several businesses on fire. [size=more than 2,000]

On 19 October 2019, in Chanaral, Atacama region, citizens protested over a general discontent with the government and against the emergency state that allowed military forces of Chile to patrol the streets of the country's capital. [size=no report]

Groups of citizens took the streets demanding changes in the social and political system in the country. There were reports of violence by rioters but no specific episode was mentioned. [size=no report]

On 19 October 2019, in Punta Arenas, Magallanes region, citizens protested over a general discontent with the government and against the emergency state that allowed military forces of Chile to patrol the streets of the country's capital. On 19 October 2019, in Providencia, Metropolitan region, citizens protested against the emergency state that allowed military forces of Chile to patrol the streets of the main capital. Several demonstrations were staged after military forces declared a curfew in the city. [size=no report]

On 19 October 2019, in Angol, Araucania region, citizens protested over a general discontent with the government and against the emergency state that allowed military forces of Chile to patrol the streets of the country's capital. [size=no report]

On 19 October 2019, Chilean president declared a state of emergency, allowing the Military Forces of Chile to intervened in the demonstrations that are taking place in the streets of the capital city. The military Forces of Chile will be in charge of patrolling the capital for the upcoming 15 days.

On 19 October 2019, in Tocopilla, Atacama region, a group of 20 rioters attacked a police guard near the police station of the municipality. One person was reported arrested. This happened after a group of citizens demonstrated against the state of emergency and the militarization of Santiago. The group blocked the road for several hours. Police forces of Chile dispersed demonstrators with tear gas. [size=20]

On 19 October 2019, in Santiago, Metropolitan region, citizens demonstrated against the emergency state that allowed military forces of Chile to patrol the streets of the main capital. Several demonstrations were staged after military forces declared a curfew in the city. The demonstrations became violent when police and military forces of Chile attempted to disperse the group. At least five buses were set on fire. [size=no report]

On 19 October 2019, in Quilpue, Valparaiso region, Police Forces of Chile beat up and tortured a civilian arrested during a demonstration in the district. The victim required to use a diaper during the trial due to the severe consequences of his injuries.

On 19 October 2019, in Villarrica, Araucania region, citizens protested over a general discontent with the government and against the emergency state that allowed military forces of Chile to patrol the streets of the country's capital. [size=no report]

On 19 October 2019, in Tome, Biobio region, demonstration called by students over a rise in the metro ticket turned in demonstrations over general discontent with the government. Groups of citizens took the streets demanding changes in the social and political system in the country. A group of rioters set on fire the municipality. [size=no report]

On 19 October 2019, in Los Angeles, Biobio region, a demonstration called by students over a rise in the metro ticket turned in demonstrations over general discontent with the government. Groups of citizens took the streets demanding changes in the social and political system in the country. Several reports of violence have been described, including looting and arson attacks. [size=no report]

On 19 October 2019, in Temuco, Araucania region, hundreds of citizens protested over a general discontent with the government and against the emergency state that allowed military forces of Chile to patrol the streets of the country's capital. After the intervention of Police Forces of Chile, a person was severely injured by a pellet shot by state officers. [size=hundreds]

On 18 October 2019, in Santiago, Metropolitan region, rioters destroyed metro stations during demonstrations against the increased of the metro rates. The demonstration, initially promoted by students, now included other citizens dissatisfied with the general increase of fares in other basic services in the country. Several arson attacks were registered along the city, rioters attacked and looted private businesses and small stores. Police attempted to disperse the group with tear gas and water hoses. 167 people were reported injured, among them 165 police officers, and 308 were arrested. [size=no report]

On 18 October 2019, in Puente Alto, Metropolitan region, students and other citizens demonstrated over a rise in the price of the metro ticket. The students and protesters jumped turnstiles in the metro stations of the district. Several station had to close their entrances. There were no reports of violence by protesters. [size=no report]

On 18 October 2019, in Quinta Normal, Metropolitan region, demonstration called by students over a rise in the metro ticket turned in demonstrations over general discontent with the government. Groups of citizens took the streets demanding changes in the social and political system in the country. Rioters destroyed metro stations in the district. Police reported at least a total of 308 people arrested in the metropolitan area. [size=no report]

On 18 October 2019, in Santiago (Metropolitana), a group of rioters set the La Granja Metro Station on fire. The event took place in the context of nationwide demonstrations against the Chilean government, whereby citizens demanded improvements in education, healthcare and pension policies, among other things. One suspect was arrested. [size=no report]

On 11 October 2019, in Santiago, Metropolitan region, a group of more than 80 students protested over a rise in the price of the metro ticket. The group initially attempted to avoid paying the ticket in two stations, but they were stopped by private security guards who blocked the entrances. Finally, in a third station, the students jumped turnstiles in the metro station Bellas Artes. [size=more than 80]

On 11 October 2019, in Valdivia (Los Rios), representatives of health unions gathered in protest at the entrance of Valdivia's Hospital Base. Participants were demonstrating over the health crisis that was affecting the provision of medicines and materials and the performance of surgical operations, among others. [size=no protest]

On 11 October 2019, in Artificio, Valparaiso region, a group of nearly 500 citizens and farmers from Petorca and Cabildo protested over the extreme drought that affects the region. The group claimed the lack of water was caused not only due to high temperatures but the excessive use of water by mining and agricultural companies in the region. The group blocked the road with the carcasses of the animal that have died due to the lack of water. [size=nearly 500]

On 11 October 2019, in Calama (Antofagasta), members of the National Federation of Drivers engaged in peaceful protest to demand more security for public transport workers. They also handed in a letter to the Regional Secretary of the Ministry of Transport in which they explained their request to upgrade security conditions. [size=no report]

As reported on 11 October 2019, in Las Condes, Metropolitan area, a group of rioters attacked two security guards, as they approach them for a search in a local park. The group beat the workers with skateboards. One of the victims was injured. [size=no report]

On 10 October 2019, in Valdivia, Araucania region, health workers protested over the lack of budget in the local hospital. The group demand improvements in infrastructure, payment rates, among other things. [size=no report]

As reported on 10 October 2019, in Temuco, Araucania region, a group of indigenous Mapuche protested against the lack of action by municipal authorities to reinforced a court ruling that orders a private citizen to open one of his/her property to build a local road. The community claimed their village remains isolated due to the perimeter fences built by the landowner. [size=no report]

On 10 October 2019, in Puren, Araucania region, truck drivers protested over an increase of attacks of unidentified militias against forest and food companies in the Araucania and Biobio regions. The group demands more protection to perform their job. Protesters blocked the road for several hours. [size=no report]

On 10 October 2019, near Victoria (Araucania), truck drivers and farmers gathered on the Route 5, blocking its traffic through the day. Participants were demonstrating against the recent killing of a colleague in Canete (Biobio), and they were calling the Government to declare the State of Emergency and ensure security against violent acts. Police officials had to intervene and arrested 5 demonstrators, releasing them later on. [size=no report]

On 9 October 2019, in San Antonio (Valparaiso), health workers of the Claudio Vicuna Hospital stopped working and gathered in protest on Luis Reuss street as part of the Medical College's National Call to pressure President Pinera (RN) and improve the national's public health system. The same demonstration took place across a number of cities in the country. [size=no report]

On 9 October 2019, in the rural area of Lautaro, Araucania region, a group of four suspected members of an indigenous militia stormed in a forest plantation company and set on fire two heavy-machines and a truck. The perpetrators threatened a civilian that was in the area at the moment of the events.

As reported on 8 October 2019, in Talca (Maule), around 50 bus drivers were mobilized for their 3rd consecutive day in protest over their working conditions. On 28 December 2018, on the road connecting Collipulli and Angol municipalities (Araucania), members of the Mapuche indigenous community blocked a route in demonstration to call for justice in the case of Camilo Catrillanca, a Mapuche leader shot dead by a member of police forces on 14 November 2018. Witnesses reported shots at the site, although no further information on this was revealed. [size=no report]

On 27 December 2018, in Puren (Araucania), members of the Mapuche community blocked a route with barricades on fire in a demonstration to call for justice in the case of Camilo Catrillanca, a Mapuche leader shot dead by a member of the police forces on 14 November 2018. [size=no report]

notes: On 27 December 2018, in Ercilla (Araucania), members of the Mapuche indigenous community set tires on fire in a demonstration, on the Route 5 South, to call for justice in the case of Camilo Catrillanca, a Mapuche leader shot dead by a member of the police forces on 14 November 2018. Around 27 December 2018 (as reported), on the road connecting Victoria and Curacautin municipalities (Araucania), members of the Mapuche community blocked a route in demonstration to call for justice in the case of Camilo Catrillanca, a Mapuche leader shot dead by a member of the police forces on 14 November 2018. Rioters clashed with police officials, leaving four of the latter with injuries from pellets and beating. No arrests were reported. [size=no report]

On 27 December 2018, in Santiago (Metropolitana), an estimate of 100 people took to the streets in a demonstration to call for justice in the case of Camilo Catrillanca, a Mapuche leader shot dead by a member of the police forces on 14 November 2018. In the aftermath of the event a group of rioters started clashing with police officials, beating them up and throwing stones and other objects at them. Clashes were also reported on the Ahumada promenade. As a result, at least five of them were injured and one official became unconscious. No arrests were reported. [size=an estimate of 100]

On 27 December 2018, in Traiguen (Araucania), members of the Mapuche indigenous community blocked a route in protest to call for justice in the case of Camilo Catrillanca, a Mapuche leader shot dead by a member of the police forces on 14 November 2018. [size=no report]
