Protesters also decried the performance of the city's Mayor. It was reported that other agricultural properties were occupied in protest on that day. [size=no report]

On 27 December 2018, in Lonquimay (Araucania), members of the Mapuche indigenous group and residents blocked traffic at the km 119 of the international highway CH 181 in protest, calling for justice in the case of Camilo Catrillanca, a Mapuche leader shot dead by a member of the police forces on 14 November 2018. [size=no report]

On 27 December 2018, in Pailahueque (Araucania), Mapuche indigenous leaders occupied an agricultural property to protest the construction of a wind farm at the site. Protesters reported those lands are ancestral and claimed they should be returned to the group. [size=no report]

Around 27 December 2018 (as reported), in Antofagasta (Calama), a protest was held in front of the Prosecutor's Office to call for justice in the case of Ximena Cortes, who died on March 2017. Protesters discarded she committed suicide, reporting she was killed by her husband. [size=no report]

Property destruction: On 27 December 2018, in Chamichaco (Araucania), unidentified individuals set fire to a house belonging to the guardian of an agricultural property. Pamphlets supporting the Mapuche cause and the death of the Mapuche leader Camilo Catrillanca were found at the site. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies.

On 27 December 2018, in La Serena (Coquimbo), an estimate of 30 people gathered in protest in front of the Municipal Council to decry the approval of the Inter-communal Regulatory Plan, which foresees to develop a port in the coastal edge of La Higuera municipality, among other projects. [size=an estimate of 30]

On 27 December 2018, in Angol (Araucania), members of the Mapuche community occupied different agricultural properties in protest to call for justice in the case of Camilo Catrillanca, a Mapuche leader shot dead by a member police forces on 14 November 2018. [size=no report]

On 27 December 2018, in Araucania, a demonstration against the death of a Mapuche and demanding the demilitarization of the area took place, including violent interactions with the police. 4 police officers were hurt.

Around 23 December 2018 (as reported), in Valparaiso (Valparaiso), bar owners and staff from the city's port held a pot-banging protest (commonly known as cacerolazo) in front of a notary office and TPS building against their monetary losses as a result the 35 day-long mobilization at the port. [size=no report]

On 23 December 2018, in Buin, Metropolitana, Police officers used violence to arrest the owner of a dog during a street fight. A video shared on social media showed the officers hitting the man. The 3 officers were discharged for excessive use of force.

Around 22 December 2018 (as reported), in Valparaiso (Valparaiso), rioters threw stones against the offices of a container shipping company during a demonstration over the city's port conflict. On 31 October 2018, in Santiago, Metropolitana, high school students clashed with police forces during a demonstration. Students used Molotov bombs, triggering the intervention of police forces. source: Estrella Loa; El Mercurio de Calama
notes: On 29 October 2018, a group of women protested in front of a prison in Calama, Chile. They were protesting the treatment of a woman after she was raped in the prison.
On 28 October 2018, almost 1000 people took the streets of Antofagasta, Chile, to protest about gender identity and abortion.

On 28 October 2018, in Hualqui, Biobio region, citizens protested against the lack of infrastructure and basic services in the commune. The group demanded improvements and the construction of a water and sewage system. [size=no report]

On 28 October 2018, during ''la Marcha por Jesus'', a march about gender identity that had 10.000 people partake, 150 rioters intervened and threw rocks at protesters in Santiago, Chile. 19 rioters were arrested, two protesters and a policeman were hurt.
On 27 October 2018, thousands of people took the streets of Temuco, Chile, to demand for lawmakers to take into account the church. [size=thousands]

On 27 October 2018, various indigenous groups and inhabitants of Puerto Montt, Chile, took the streets to protest the possible construction of a hydroelectric plant and its potential effects on the environment.

On 26 October 2018, in Valparaiso, Valparaiso region, riots broke out as police attempted to seized products from street sellers. On 26 October 2018, hundreds of senior citizens took the streets of Talca, Maule, Chile, to demand more inclusivity for the elderly.

On 25 October 2018, in Malla Malla, Biobio region, a group of 20 people carried out a demonstration over the lack of public service in the area. The group claimed the bus company intentionally ignored other areas of the commune. [size=20]

On 25 October 2018, employees of Zofri demonstrated in front of the Zofri office in Iquique, Tarapaca, Chile. Several windows were smashed and four people were arrested after a police intervention. The employees demonstrated a payment delays.

Around 25 October 2018, in Providencia, Metropolitan, parents and students from a school protested near a local broadcast channel over a news article that claimed students were preparing to be part of an anarchist organization. Around 25 October 2018 (as reported), in Valparaiso, Valparaiso region, teachers of local kindergartens protested over increasing insecurity in the area. The group reported a rise in the armed clashes between local gangs, which endangers the lives of children and teachers. The group demanded more police in the area. [size=no report]

On 24 October 2018, more than 500 protesters took the streets of Vina del Mar, Valparaiso, Chile, to protest the closing of the Winterhill school. The school is closing due to financial problems, which will leave 450 students without a school to attend.

On 24 October 2018, in Valparaiso, Valparaiso region, riots broke out as police attempted to seized products from street sellers. In a video leaked to the press, a police officer used his gun to threaten the group. There were no reports of injured/killed. [size=no report]
On 24 October 2018, protesters took the streets of Valdivia, Los Rios, Chile, to protest against AFP, the national pension system.
On 24 October 2018, protesters took the streets of Calama, Chile, to protest against AFP, the national pension system. [size=no report]
On 24 October 2018, secondary students in Santiago, Chile, protested in front of the Chilean congress against a new law that makes it easier for schools to expel students.

On 24 October 2018, in Concepcion, Biobio region, bus driver staged a protest over poor work conditions. No people were reported injured or killed.

Around 23 October 2018 (as reported), in Concepcion, Biobio region, students and parents of a local school protested over the lack of funding for a local school. On 23 October 2018, in Concepcion, Biobio region, nearly 150 students of a girls' school protested over the deterioration of the school facilities. Students demanded improvements in the infrastructure. Police arrested 14 protesters when the group blocked the street. [size=nearly 150]

On 16 October 2018, in Osorno (Los Lagos), teachers, inspectors and administrative workers held a protest outside the Blas Pascal School demanding equal working conditions and salary increases, among other issues. Protesters declared their imminent strike. [size=no report]

Around 15 October 2018 (month of), in Providencia, Metropolitan region, three police officers opened fire against a group of civilians in a local park. On 14 October 2018, in Santiago (Metropolitana), thousands of people took the streets during a march to demand the liberation of Mapuche political prisoners, end of violence towards this indigenous group as well as the return of their ancestral lands, among other things. On 8 July 2018, in Santiago (Metropolitana), residents of Las Condes neighbourhood held a pot-banging protest (commonly known as cacerolazo) against the construction of social housing in the area. [size=no report]

Property destruction: On 2 July 2018, in Carahue (Araucania), a group of four armed masked men set on fire heavy machinery that belonged to a local forest company at the San Alberto ranch. There is no report of people injured. Eight engines were destroyed in the attack. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies.

source: El Mercurio de Calama; Austral Temuco; La Nacion (Chile)
notes: Property destruction: On 2 July 2018, between Nueva Imperial and Carahue (Araucania), members of Mapuche Militiamen set fire to forestry machinery that belonged to a local forest company at the San Alberto ranch, in the Codigua sector. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies.

The demonstration turned violent with a small group of rioters setting up barricades, setting fires and confronting the police forces. Some local stores reported damages. 43 people were arrested. [size=2,000]

Around 1 May 2018 (as reported), in Osorno, Los Lagos region, environmental activists and members of indigenous communities protested against the privatization of the water in the country. The group demanded modification to the law to consider access to water as a universal right instead of a profiting good. [size=no report]

Around 30 April 2018 (as reported), in Osorno, Los Lagos region, taxi drivers protested over the death of one of their colleagues in a car accident. The group demands justice for the victim. [size=no report]

On 30 April 2018, 200 people staged a demonstration in front of the Tribunal in Los Andes town (Los Andes, Los Andes, Valparaiso) to demand justice for the 1 year and 7 months old girl who died after being raped by her aunt's partner. Rioters threw stones at the Minister of Justice Hernan Larrain and tried to remove the fences protecting the facilities. The police forces intervened to take control of the situation. [size=200]

Around 30 April 2018 (as reported), in Calama, Antofagasta region, a large group of people protested against the water privatization. The group marched through the streets until the city center. [size=a large group]

Around 30 April 2018 (as reported), in San Felipe, Valparaiso region, a group of citizens protested to demand justice in a case of child abuse reported in the district. The group marched through the streets and demanded justice and more effective laws to punish cases of child abuse in the country. [size=no report]

On 29 April 2018, 300 local inhabitants took to the streets in Rinconada de los Andes locality (Rinconada, Los Andes, Valparaiso) to demand justice for the 1 year and 7 months old girl who died after being raped by her aunt's partner. [size=300]

On 29 April 2018, law students from the University of Chile took over the Faculty of Law at the university in Santiago city (Santiago, Santiago, Metropolitana de Santiago) to demand improvements in the faculty's sexual harassment protocol. [size=no report]

Around 28 April 2018, in Valdivia, Los Rios region, citizens and members of the Mapuche indigenous community protested against the construction of infrastructure projects in natural reserve areas. The group claimed that such projects endangered fragile eco-systems in the region. The group also demanded the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. [size=no report]

Protesters raised awareness on the situation of senior people and protested against the non-fulfilment by the government regarding the social rights and social security of senior people. [size=no report]

On 28 April 2018, in Concepcion (Biobio), workers took to the streets of the city in a protest against the stipulated contribution of their salaries to the National Pension Funds Administrators. [size=no report]
On 27 April 2018, in San Antonio, Valparaiso region, 53 health workers protested over poor work conditions. The group demanded improvements in the payments wages. [size=53]

On 27 April 2018, in San Antonio, Valparaiso region, students protested over poor sanitary conditions of a local school. The group marched towards the main square to demand the sanitation of the building. [size=no report]

On 27 April 2018, law students from the University of Chile took over the Faculty of Law at the university in Santiago city (Santiago, Santiago, Metropolitana de Santiago) to demand improvements in the faculty's sexual harassment protocol. [size=no report]

On 27 April 2018, in Concepcion, Biobio region, feminists and women's organizations protested against gender-based violence in the country. The group demanded justice for all victims of femicide. [size=no report]

On 26 April 2018, in Santiago (Metropolitana), retirees and political authorities, including the Mayor of Independencia municipality, gathered in front of La Moneda Palace in protest, calling for authorities to reduce fares of public transport for senior adults. Protesters handed in a letter to President Pinera (RN) thereafter. [size=no report]

On 26 April 2018, managers of correctional services tried to take over the Gendarmerie building, in Santiago city (Santiago, Santiago, Metropolitana de Santiago), to protest against the delay in their promotion and against the criminalization of their work. The police forces intervened to reopen the traffic, which was blocked due to the protest. [size=no report]

On 26 April 2018, in San Antonio, Valparaiso region, pensioned teachers protested over low pension payments. The group gathered in the main square to demand increases in their pensions. [size=no report]

On 26 April 2018, 300 people belonging to the Movimiento Vina de los Cerros staged a demonstration against the administration of Virginia Reginato (mayor of Vina del Mar) in front of the O'Higgins Hotel, in Vina del Mar town (Vina del Mar, Valparaiso, Valparaiso), where Virginia Reginato was reporting on her management. The police forces intervened to secure the access to the building, and after incidents were reported. 6 demonstrators were arrested. [size=300]

On 25 April 2018, in Temuco, Araucania region, a group of citizens protested over delays in a police investigation on a traffic accident. Families of the victims gathered to demand answers and reported potential bias from local authorities as the victims of the accident were Mapuche indigenous people. [size=no report]

Around 25 April 2018, in Iquique, Tarapaca region, self-employed workers at Iquique and Alto Hospicio protested against the lack of regulations for the companies that contract their services. The group asked for better laws to improve their work conditions. [size=no report]
On 25 April 2018, in Calama, Antofagasta region, children marched to raise awareness of child abuse prevention. [size=no report]

Property destruction: On 24 April 2018, in the rural area of Quepe municipality, Araucania region, suspected indigenous militia men set fire to an event center that belonged to the energy company. Pamphlets demanding justice over the death of a Mapuche activist and the release of Mapuche arrested individuals were found in the area.

assoc_actor_1: Students (Chile); CONFECH: Confederation of Chilean Students
notes: On 24 April 2018, students from the University of Chile affiliated with FECH and CONFECH staged a brief protest at the University of Chile, in Santiago city (Santiago, Santiago, Metropolitana de Santiago), against the controversial words of the Minister of Education Gerardo Varela. The protest happened during a speech by Gerardo Varela, as part of the inauguration of the academic year. [size=no report]

On 24 April 2018, in Valdivia, Los Rios region, students and feminist organizations protested over the reparation payment to a professor dismissed after accusation of sexual misconduct. The group claimed that the worker should not receive any compensation, considering that he was dismissed for just cause. The students blocked the main entrance to two of the university faculties for several days. [size=no report]

Around 24 April 2018 (as reported), in Coronel, Biobio region, a group of 30 families camped on the streets to protest against a series of evictions. The group claimed that local authorities missed the payments that support vulnerable families with the rent fees resulting in the ejection of families from several homes. [size=30 families]

Property destruction: On 24 April 2018, in Quepe, Freire area (Cautin, La Araucania), suspected Mapuche indigenous militiamen set the CGE events centre on fire. The police found a message in support to Celestino Cordova, a Mapuche leader currently serving a sentence in prison for killing a couple in 2013. No injuries or fatalities.

On 24 April 2018, in San Antonio, Valparaiso region, 300 truck drivers protested against low payments wages in the local port. The group organized a motorcade of 150 trucks to demand increases in the rates for drivers that work delivering goods to the San Antonio harbor. [size=300]

On 24 April 2018, in Concepcion, Biobio region, nearly 150 residents from Hualqui and other nearby communes from Concepcion, together with the city's Mayor and health workers, marched in a protest to call for more security in the city. The protest was sparked by the double homicide that took place on 22 April at a health center in the city. [size=nearly 150]

On 24 April 2018, workers from Canal 13 staged a protest inside the Canal 13 facilities in Providencia locality (Providencia, Santiago, Metropolitana de Santiago) against the alleged dismissal of 300 workers. [size=no report]

On 24 April 2018, in Talcahuano, Biobio region, anglers demonstrated against increasing difficulties to perform their work. The group staged a boat protest calling for laws that protect traditional fishing techniques and prioritize small-scale fishing. The group also demanded larger fishing allowances. [size=no report]

Property destruction: On 24 April 2018, in Llico, Biobio region, suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to equipment from an logging company. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights.

On 24 April 2018, in Valdivia (Los Rios), a protest was held at the city's viaduct in support of the Mapuche spiritual leader Celestino Cordova, accused of having murdered the Luchsinger-Mackay couple in Vilcun (Araucania) during an arson attack on 4 January 2013. [size=no report]

On 23 April 2018, in Puerto Montt (Los Lagos), more than 100 Mapuche indigenous people occupied the city's cathedral in protest in support of the Mapuche spiritual leader Celestino Cordova, accused of having murdered the Luchsinger-Mackay couple in Vilcun (Araucania) during an arson attack on 4 January 2013. Protesters demanded authorities to grant the leader, on a hunger strike, a permission to exit prison to perform a religious celebration. It was reported protesters abandoned the site four days after. [size=more than 100]

Around 23 April 2018 (as reported), in Temuco (Araucania), family members of the Mapuche spiritual leader Celestino Cordoba took to the streets in a protest to demand authorities to grant the latter a permission to exit prison to perform a religious celebration. Around 23 April 2018, in Concepcion, Biobio region, citizens protested over an accidental gas explosion that killed several people in a local hospital. In a motorcade towards the cemetery, the group demanded accountability from the building administrator. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: Students (Chile); CONFECH: Confederation of Chilean Students; ACES: Coordinating Assembly of High-school Students of Chile; Teachers (Chile); CONES: National Coordinator of High-school Students
notes: On 19 April 2018, thousands of teachers and students affiliated with FECH, CONFECH, CONES and ACES, took to the streets in Santiago city (Santiago, Santiago, Metropolitana de Santiago), as part of the first national student march, to demand the end of profit in higher education, the introduction of a sexual education programme in schools and the end of sexist education at university. Some rioters vandalized the public space and threw pieces of broken glass at the police forces, who used teargas to disperse the rioters. In front of the Arcis University a rioter who had been throwing stones was run over by a police patrol, the events are currently under investigation. As a result, 180 rioters were arrested (including 50 minors). The president of the FECH was allegedly beaten by the police forces while being arrested. According to the organizers, 120,000 people participated in the demonstration, whereas according to the police forces 30,000 did. [size=30,000-120,000]

On 19 April 2018, in Temuco (Araucania), students took to the streets in a protest as part of the first national student march. Police forces intervened to disperse demonstrators, and neither injuries nor arrests were reported. [size=no report]

On 19 April 2018, in Temuco (Araucania), a protest was held outside the city's hospital in support of the Mapuche spiritual leader Celestino Cordova, accused of having murdered the Luchsinger-Mackay couple in Vilcun (Araucania) during an arson attack on 4 January 2013. Protesters demanded authorities to grant the leader, on a hunger strike, a permission to exit prison to perform a religious celebration. [size=no report]

On 18 April 2018, supporters of Celestino Cordova (sentenced for the killing of the Luchsinger Mackay couple) blocked the accesses to the Temuco comuna (Cautin, La Araucania), erecting barricades and burning tires, to demonstrate against the health condition of Celestino Cordova and to demand the authorities to grant him a permit for a few days so that he can lead a ceremonial activity. Police forces intervened to prevent them from accessing the site, although participants managed to evade them. Participants were demonstrating against delay in payments of settlements, and attempted to handle a letter to the Secretary of Education to show their demands. [size=no report]

On 3 January 2018, in Providencia (Metropolitana), teachers, directors, and students staged a protest in front of the City Hall against the massive dismissal of teachers from the commune, calling authorities to summon a public tender. [size=no report]
On 2 January 2018, in Quinta Normal (Metropolitana), a group of garbage collectors held a protest against delay in payments. [size=no report]

On 2 January 2018, in Coquimbo (Coquimbo), a group of illegal sellers staged a demonstration at the city's creek against the municipality's decision to evict them from the site. It was reported demonstrators provoked violent incidents, although there was no further information on this. [size=no report]

Property destruction: On 1 January 2018, in San Juan de la Costa (Los Lagos), at least ten unidentified men set fire to machinery under at an agricultural property. Pamphlets supporting the Mapuche cause were found near the place of the event. The same group had carried out the same attack hours before in Rio Negro. The Araucania and Lagos regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies.

Property destruction: On 1 January 2018, in Rio Negro, Los Lagos, at least ten unidentified men set fire to machinery after firing in the air at an agricultural property. Neither injuries, fatalities, nor arrests were reported. The Araucania and Lagos regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies.
